racecards.race_name: Get The Inside Track With raceday-ready.com Handicap

runners.comment: Second in three recent handicaps (5.5f-6f); back in trip with headgear added here
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in three consecutive handicaps this spring (5.5f-6f); will be a tough nut to crack if combination of drop back to bare 5f and first-time cheekpieces has any positive effect.

runners.comment: Third at Chepstow last month and not discredited in small field soon afterwards; respected
runners.spotlight: Bettered low-key seasonal/handicap debut when keeping-on third at Chepstow (5f, good) last month and also ran well when second in small field at Lingfield (5f, good to firm) soon afterwards; recent 2lb drop helps and she may still have a bigger performance in her; respected.

runners.comment: Placed in first-time cheekpieces last month but back in the doldrums on next outing
runners.spotlight: Seemed to respond well to first-time cheekpieces when placed at Beverley (5f, good to firm) last month but was back in the doldrums at Nottingham a few days later; others have more persuasive profiles.

runners.comment: Won on AW in February but refused to race on consecutive appearances last month
runners.spotlight: Won on the AW in February and is on a workable mark if able to transfer that form to turf, but she refused to race on consecutive appearances last month and comes with very obvious risk attached.

runners.breeder: Patrick Cosgrove & Lope De Vega Synd
runners.comment: Five-race maiden, absent since safely held in two AW nurseries (6f/8.6f) in the autumn
runners.spotlight: Five-race maiden, absent since safely held in two AW nurseries (6f/8.6f) in the autumn; could plausibly be seen to better effect back at 5f on turf this year but others in the line-up have much less to prove.

runners.comment: Runner-up in three of her four 5f handicaps this year; bold bid from the front is likely
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in three of her four 5f handicaps for new stable this year, the last two on turf with a hood fitted; nudged up 2lb since last time but can give this a good shot from the front.

runners.comment: Second at Chelmsford on Thursday but not very reliable and not yet proven on turf
runners.spotlight: Led close home to open account at Chelmsford (5f, AW) in January, her seventh start, and rebounded from a lesser effort when second over that C&D on Thursday; not one to rely upon, though, and not yet proven on turf.

runners.comment: Won on AW in April and has run okay on turf since but is not the percentage call here
runners.spotlight: Returned from a break with win at Southwell (5f, AW; refitted hood/first-time tongue-tie) in April and subsequently ran okay on turf; well beaten when back at Southwell recently (restless in stalls), though, and not the percentage call here.

racecards.betting_forecast: 5/2 Novamay, 7/2 Wee Mary, 4/1 Step Along, 7/1 Love Rock, 8/1 Solar Biricz,  Master Zack, 14/1 Pure Artistry, 25/1 Sun Keeper

racecards.race_name: Lauras Dance Academy Handicap

runners.comment: Won 5f Beverley seller in May; fair run next time; well beaten on stable debut 4 days ago
runners.spotlight: Won a Beverley seller (5f, good to firm) for David Evans last month and finished a decent second in a Chepstow handicap eight days later (5f, good); not so good since and was well beaten in a 5f Yarmouth handicap on stable debut four days ago.

runners.comment: Bath maiden winner for Jack Channon last May; modest efforts since including for this yard
runners.spotlight: Won a Bath maiden for Jack Channon last May (5.5f, good); hasn't done as well since and has been well beaten on both starts (AW) for this new yard; tongue-tie tried; plenty to prove.

quotes.race: Daily Price Boosts At Yeeehaaa.Bet British EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands C/D) (Qual') (GBB)
quotes.quote: Spirited Dancer showed a lot of promise at Kempton but it was a non-event when she was unbalanced here next time. Jack and the team have been happy with her at home and I came here expecting a big run. She delivered - Eddie Greatrex, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: She won her maiden at Bath in May. She ran in the big sales race won by The Dragon King at Newmarket on Saturday, finishing down the field. She's a sweet filly who does everything well. 10-10-24

runners.comment: Below par last time but chance on his second in a fair handicap at Yarmouth in April
runners.spotlight: Bit disappointing on easier ground on latest turf start at Leicester (6f, good to soft) but has a chance on his previous run on grass when 4l second to a progressive sort at Yarmouth (6f, good to firm; form sound).

runners.comment: Has shaped well on a couple of occasions, including over 7f on turf two runs back
runners.spotlight: Good third on Nottingham debut last season (5f, good to firm); mixed form since, best effort when 3.75l fifth at Leicester in April (7f, good); poor run on good to soft with a hood tried last time (left off here).

runners.comment: Winner over 5.5f at Wetherby last time (form sound); chance off this 5lb higher mark
runners.spotlight: Off the mark when beating a reliable sort (second again since) over 5.5f at Wetherby last time (good to firm); a possible off this 5lb higher mark.

runners.breeder: Scea Marmion Vauville, Ecurie Skymarc Fa
runners.comment: Maiden winner over 6f last July; mixed results since and not in top form last three starts
runners.spotlight: Won a turf maiden at Lingfield last July (6f, good to firm); mixed form since and not at his best with cheekpieces or blinkers on last three starts

runners.comment: Improved since handicapping; beaten less than 2l latest (5f); 6f suits; each-way chance
runners.spotlight: Unexposed; two fair runs since gong handicapping, last time going down by less than 2l when fifth of eight at Redcar (5f, good to firm); return to 6f should suit; each-way chance.

runners.comment: Promise in two 5f maidens; off since August; hood tried on first run at 6f; handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Showed a degree of promise in two 5f maidens last summer (ran flat when well beaten on final start); off since August; hooded and upped to 6f for handicap debut.

runners.comment: Maiden winner last August; mixed form since; below par last three runs; new headgear tried
runners.spotlight: Won a Brighton maiden for Eve Johnson Houghton last August (6f, good); mixed form since (two best runs were over 7f) and has been below par last three starts, latest on soft ground; new headgear, a hood and blinkers, now tried.

runners.comment: Some promise over 5f and quite interesting on first run at 6f on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Has shown a degree of promise in two novices and maiden over 5f; quite interesting on first run at 6f now going handicapping

runners.comment: Best run when nose second on AW in November; not fared as well back on turf this term
runners.spotlight: Best run when a nose second in a Newcastle nursery on handicap debut last November (6f); hasn't reproduced that form in two runs on turf this year; bit to prove now

runners.comment: Well beaten at long odds in three AW contests; needs to improve on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Well beaten at long odds in three 6f races on the AW in April/May; needs to improve now going handicapping for the first time.

runners.comment: Won at Carlisle last time but faster ground and 9lb hike the weights to contend with here
runners.spotlight: Placed in two AW handicaps before getting off the mark on second turf start in a 6f Carlisle handicap (good to soft), beating Sharon Curly, who runs in the 4.35, by 2.75l; has faster ground and a 9lb hike in the weights to contend with here.

runners.comment: Unexposed; beaten 2l on handicap debut over 5f latest; 6f should suit; each-way chance
runners.spotlight: Some promise in 5f maidens last season; beaten only 2l when sixth of eight on handicap debut at Redcar last time (5f, good to firm); step up to 6f should suit; each-way chance.

runners.comment: Ex-Karl Burke; exposed 12-race maiden who needs to improve on recent efforts
runners.spotlight: Ex-Karl Burke; exposed 12-race maiden who is on a fair mark but needs to improve on his recent form; poor run last time with cheekpieces which are left off here.

runners.comment: Unplaced in his nine races so far; plenty to find with Atomic Mass on recent Wetherby form
runners.spotlight: Yet to be placed in any of his nine races and was beaten nearly 8l by Atomic Mass at Wetherby last time (5.5f, good to firm).

runners.comment: Pulled too hard when last over 7f last time; may do better at 6f; bit to prove
runners.spotlight: Fairly exposed; pulled too hard when last of ten in a 7f Redcar handicap last time; may fare better at 6f but a bit to prove.

racecards.betting_forecast: 4/1 Atomic Mass, 5/1 Promise Time, 13/2 Fair Call, 15/2 Memphisatmidnight, 8/1 Cooramook, 10/1 Get Up Everybody, 12/1 Pancake, 14/1 Coeur Jaune, 16/1 Bust A Moon,  Alashos,  Vault Of Heaven, 20/1 Yorkshire Myth, 25/1 Spirited Dancer, 33/1 Captain Pickles,  Rokuni, 50/1 Piddie's Pearl,  Triple Charged

racecards.race_name: Mr Dans Entertainment Handicap

runners.comment: Placed on three over her seven starts, including last time; best form on good to soft
runners.spotlight: Placed on three of her seven starts, last time finishing second at Leicester (7f, good to soft) to a subsequent winner; chance on that form but best efforts have been on good to soft.

runners.comment: 7f AW winner in March; not as good on turf since (troubled run latest) but place chance
runners.spotlight: 7f AW winner in March; hasn't run as well on turf on last three starts, albeit getting no sort of run when 6l sixth at Ripon last time (6f, good); each-way chance.

runners.comment: 22,000gns buy last July; modest efforts so far, including on handicap debut over 1m here
runners.spotlight: Ex-Michael Bell; bought for 22,000gns last July; just ordinary form so far, last time on handicap debut when 17l tenth of 12 over 1m here (good to firm); best watched.

runners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd
runners.comment: Improved since handicapping, second over 6f on latest start; stays 7f; a possible
runners.spotlight: Progressive form since going handicapping, following up her close fourth at Redcar (7f, good to firm) by finishing runner-up over 6f at Carlisle (good to soft); a possible.

runners.comment: 7f Redcar winner two runs ago but only fifth over same C&D next time; down 4lb; possible
runners.spotlight: Came late to snatch a 7f Redcar handicap two runs ago (good to firm; form didn't work out) but was only fifth of ten with 6lb penalty over same C&D eight days later; 4lb better off here; not ruled out.

runners.comment: All five races on AW, best run when second at Southwell in February (6f); 85-day break
runners.spotlight: All five races have been on the AW, best run when second at Southwell in February (6f); well beaten behind Miakoda over 7f at Newcastle next time; makes turf debut after 85-day break.

runners.comment: Unexposed but has shown little, tailed off over 8.5f on handicap debut; hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Unexposed but hard to fancy, as she's been well beaten at triple-figure odds in novice/maiden company and finished last of ten when 80-1 for handicap debut (8.5f, good).

runners.comment: Minor promise in three maidens; needs to improve on handicap debut; worth a market check
runners.spotlight: Minor promise in three maidens from 5f-7f; needs to improve on handicap debut; worth a market check.

runners.owner: Hunscote Stud Ltd & Darren P Bowden
runners.comment: Has not shown much in maidens/novice on AW; needs to improve now handicapping; turf debut
runners.spotlight: Hasn't shown a great deal in maiden/novice company on the AW and needs to improve now going handicapping on turf.

runners.comment: Second in a 7.5f nursery for Roger Fell last year; poor efforts otherwise; headgear tried
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in a Beverley nursery last August (7.5f, good to firm; 50-1) when with Roger Fell; poor efforts otherwise, including on both starts for this yard this year; cheekpieces are now tried.

stable_tour.quote: She's ready to run and has had a few entries. She was only small when she came to us. The owners had her in a field down the road. She's done nothing wrong whatsoever and she's improved after each gallop, so she's going to be the type to improve after a run or two. She could be okay. 21-06-24

runners.comment: Best run when 2nd in 7f AW h'cap in April; not so good over 1m since; chance back at 7f
runners.spotlight: Best form when runner-up in a 7f Wolverhampton handicap in April; well beaten over further on both starts since, including on turf debut last time, but likely to fare better back at 7f and could go well.

runners.comment: Best form when fourth at Ripon on h'cap debut (6f, form sound); interesting back at 7f
runners.spotlight: Ran her best race when a staying-on fourth to a previous winner in a 6f Ripon handicap last time (good; second and fifth have won since); return to 7f should suit; interesting.

runners.comment: 0-9; has run the occasional fair race but only 4th of five on AW latest; more needed
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden; has run the occasional fair race but was only fourth of five at Wolverhampton last time (6f); more needed.

racecards.betting_forecast: 7/2 Sharon Curly, 4/1 Miakoda, 5/1 Queen's Palace, 11/2 Toota, 6/1 I Can Boogy, 12/1 Sandinyourshoes,  Sugar Kane, 14/1 Invincible Storm, 16/1 Dolly's Delight, 20/1 Mavetheforcebewivu, 33/1 Morning Angel,  Jimmy Henry, 50/1 She's A Goldigger

racecards.race_name: Little Princess Parties Handicap

prev_owners.owner: Anthony Ramsden, Nigel Skinner & Ron Hull

runners.comment: Out of sorts for new stable this year
runners.spotlight: Placed three consecutive times on slow ground (1m-1m2f) for Ralph Beckett in the autumn but has looked badly out of sorts for new stable this year and needs a revival.

quotes.race: Play Coral "Racing-Super-Series" For Free Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: It was testing and we were scratching our heads in the final stages as we hadn't got the job done yet, fortunately he got his head in front. I thought I was going to win easily two furlongs out, but Whiskey Pete was waiting the whole last furlong and went away when one came to him - Hector Crouch, jockey.

runners.comment: Ran as though something was amiss when favourite for recent stable/handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Promising as 2yo for Godolphin; missed his 3yo season and ran as though something was amiss when favourite for recent stable/handicap debut but remains unexposed and it will be interesting to see whether his supporters wade in again here; hooded for first time.

runners.comment: Very well handicapped now but has become inconsistent and was soundly beaten last week
runners.spotlight: Now 13lb lower than when runner-up in major handicap at Glorious Goodwood (1m, good to firm) last summer but has become very inconsistent and was safely held when back at Goodwood nine days ago; hard to predict.

quotes.quote: I'm a bit frustrated. I thought Dutch Decoy was the best chance we had in the race. Obviously the winner has come from stall 21, but you need the rub of the green from there and from two and a half to the furlong marker we were all dressed up with nowhere to go. I actually thought my two in front were setting it up perfectly for him because they went a strong gallop. We'll just have to make sure we're back here next year - Charlie Johnston, trainer.

Dutch Decoy does prefer quicker ground and I thought when this rain came it might be too much for him, but we have probably got away with it. He ran at Goodwood last year [Golden Mile] and I think he will probably go back there - Jock Bennett, assistant trainer.
I feel a bit sorry for Dutch Decoy because he's been banging his head against a brick wall all spring. His time is coming - Charlie Johnston, trainer.
Joe Fanning rides Dutch Decoy normally and he just told me to let the old boy do his thing and it paid off - Ben Curtis, jockey.

runners.comment: 2-3 on AW but has performed well only one of four turf starts; others look less risky
runners.spotlight: 2-3 on AW, having won over 1m at Newcastle last month, but performed well on only one of his four turf starts (last summer's debut); dropped 5lb since last at Redcar four weeks ago but still looks risky on this surface.

quotes.quote: Savvy Kingdom is a very nice horse. Fair play to Mr Woods [trainer] and the team at home. He had a little setback but the owners have been very patient and it's paid off. We'll be going a mile and two [furlongs] I'd say with him next time on turf and that should suit him perfectly - Ben Sanderson, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.comment: Best known as a sprinter; ran okay when upped to 1m last month but others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Best known as a sprinter; placed over 7f on Tapeta this spring and was not disgraced when upped to 1m for quite valuable Polytrack handicap a fortnight ago, but may still be vulnerable to specialist milers here.

runners.comment: Yet to hit top gear this season (four runs) but back on a good mark now; interesting
runners.spotlight: Three-time 1m winner last season; yet to hit top gear after four starts this year but encountered traffic when never dangerous at Hamilton recently and is back on a good mark now; worth a second look.

runners.breeder: D Farrington, P Gately, T Killarney
runners.comment: Dual 7f winner this year; can cope with this return to 1m; probably won't be far away
runners.spotlight: Dual 7f winner this year, latterly when clinging on by a nose at Yarmouth (good to firm) last month; placed under 7lb claimer there soon afterwards and can cope with this return to 1m; probably won't be far away.

runners.comment: Won readily off a reduced mark at Pontefract last month and has possibilities here
runners.spotlight: May not be as good as he was but appeared to have a bit left in the tank when winning readily off his reduced mark at Pontefract (1m, good to firm) last month and has possibilities here, having gone back up 5lb.

quotes.quote: We bought Mount King second hand at the Horses In Training Sale from Joseph O'Brien and he's been a lovely horse for the owners - Tim Easterby, trainer.

racecards.betting_forecast: 11/4 Duke's Command, 7/2 Mount King, 4/1 Shaw Park, 7/1 Dutch Decoy, 8/1 Jimmy Speaking,  Hale End, 12/1 Savvy Kingdom, 20/1 Whiskey Pete

racecards.race_name: Turn The Page And Read "Confined" Novice Stakes (No More Than Two Runs) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Struggled in a bumper and on hurdling debut; big outsider on Flat debut
runners.spotlight: Struggled on bumper debut in Ireland in 2023 and pulled up when reappearing over hurdles for new yard last month; big outsider on Flat debut.

runners.breeder: S A S Haras Le Gue
runners.comment: Showed only minor promise for Roger Teal on debut in December (7f); now with new yard
runners.spotlight: Showed only minor promise for Roger Teal on debut in December (7f, AW); hiked up in trip for new yard; hood removed; can only be watched.

runners.comment: 15,000gns yearling; dam placed at 7f/1m (RPR 76); unlikely to be good enough on debut
runners.spotlight: 15,000gns yearling; first foal; dam placed at 7f/1m (RPR 76), half-sister to 7f Group 3 winner Regal Realm; unlikely to be good enough.

runners.comment: Drew just over 4l clear of Gravitas when winning recent Beverley maiden; leading contender
runners.spotlight: Well-bred colt who delivered on debut promise when drawing just over 4l clear of Gravitas to score at Beverley (1m4f, good) three weeks ago; leading contender.

quotes.race: bet365 Very British Raceday Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was only Tarriance's second run and he's still a bit inexperienced. He was in the stalls a long time and didn't get the best of starts. But I knew he stays really well and he was the best horse in the race. He's got a great attitude. He's a big, raw horse and he'll probably get further in time - P J McDonald, jockey.

runners.owner: J William Rowley & S P C Woods
runners.comment: Belied 50-1 odds and ran big race when third in valuable Newmarket novice last month
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on debut in April but belied 50-1 odds and ran big race when third of six in valuable Newmarket novice (1m4f, good to firm) last month; must be considered after that performance.

runners.comment: Came from off the pace to win comfortably on recent debut at Windsor (11.4f)
runners.spotlight: Displayed rather awkward head carriage but kept on strongly from the rear to win comfortably on debut at Windsor (11.4f, good; tongue-tie fitted) three weeks ago; this race is deeper but it's very hard to gauge the limit of her ability.

runners.comment: No match for Tarriance when second at Beverley but is 7lb better off with him here
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on both starts, latterly when no match for Tarriance at Beverley (1m4f, good) three weeks ago; 7lb better off with that rival here and has each-way claims.

runners.comment: Behind two of these when third at Windsor; can improve but needs to learn to settle
runners.spotlight: Made quite a promising debut in good Chester maiden in May but behind Bomba Del Mundo and Port George when third at Windsor (11.4f, good) three weeks ago and needs to settle better in the early stages here.

runners.comment: Left poor debut behind when 50-1 second at Windsor last month; more is needed again
runners.spotlight: Left inauspicious debut a long way behind when 50-1 second to Bomba Del Mundo at Windsor (11.4f, good) three weeks ago but needs to take another good step forward.

runners.comment: Out of a useful 7f winner but has good standard to reach on debut
runners.spotlight: Third foal; half-brother to very useful 5f-7f winner Brazen Bolt; dam useful 7f winner; has good standard to reach on debut.

racecards.betting_forecast: Evs Tarriance, 7/2 Bahadur, 4/1 Bomba Del Mundo, 8/1 Gravitas, 12/1 Little Saver, 20/1 Port George, 50/1 Rocky Gb, 100/1 Mr Withington,  Burlington Place, 250/1 Garswood Gold

racecards.race_name: Yorkshire Air Ambulance EBF Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.owner: Alfa Site Services Ltd & Graeme Curnow
runners.comment: Never looked dangerous when fifth of 11 at York but this race is easier; interesting
runners.spotlight: Showed her inexperience and never really looked dangerous when fifth of 11 at York (6f, good) a fortnight ago but significant positives can be drawn from that performance and she's of interest in this easier race.

runners.comment: Out of Group-placed 1m2f winner; by Waldgeist; likely to need further than 7f to show bext
runners.spotlight: 12,000euros yearling; fifth foal; half-sister to winners If Not Now (1m 2yo/1m2f; RPR 103) and Agneta (German 1m2f); dam Group-placed 1m2f winner (104), half-sister to 7f 2yo Group 3 winner Coral Beach; by Waldgeist and will probably need further than 7f to be seen to best effect.

runners.comment: Out of a Listed-placed 2yo winner and looks the part on paper
runners.spotlight: Second foal; half-sister to 7f 2yo/8.5f winner Celeborn (RPR 93); dam Listed-placed 5f 2yo winner (93), half-sister to Listed-placed 6f 2yo winner Clochette; looks the part on paper.

runners.comment: Improved form when third of five over 7f on second start; more needed again
runners.spotlight: Improved upon her low-key debut (6f) when third of five at Lingfield (7f, good) a fortnight ago but that form isn't anything to get too excited about and she probably needs to progress again.

runners.comment: Runner-up over 5f on all three starts; big player if this new trip suits
runners.spotlight: Runner-up over 5f on all three starts; might have bumped into a useful newcomer at Catterick 16 days ago and has a big role to play here if suited by the longer trip.

runners.comment: Out of a useful 7.5f-1m2f winner; market support will make her of interest
runners.spotlight: Second foal; half-sister to 8.3f winner Soul Dance (RPR 74); dam 7.5f-1m2f winner (96), sister to Group-placed 6f-1m winner Born In Bombay, half-sister to winners Sparkling Beam (1m1f Group 3) and Rainbow Springs (Group-placed 1m1f); market support will make her of interest.

racecards.betting_forecast: 9/4 Artanis, 3/1 Homestrait, 7/2 Alfa Patisserie, 7/1 Amora Queen,  Hazy Cosmic Jane, 10/1 Just Call Me Angel

racecards.race_name: Grace And Dotty Fedoras And Feathers Handicap (Div II)

prev_owners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd And G Tuer

runners.comment: In good form over 6f this spring and 7f also suits; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Career-best form when winning in first-time visor at Thirsk (6f, good) in April and comes here after two perfectly respectable runs over that trip last month (blinkers refitted last time); 7f also suits; in the mix.

quotes.quote: Wreck It Ryley has done it well. I was just waiting for the gap to appear. He's run in blinkers a few times before and they do help him because he's a bit behind the bridle normally. He keeps breaking half a stride too slowly, but he's soon there on the heels of the leaders and he was there when I needed him. I had plenty of horse underneath me to commit and go - Dale Swift, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He has been a busy lad this season with 14 runs and two wins. On his latest start at Ayr they virtually trotted to the three-furlong marker before sprinting. He wasn't best positioned for that but he came home well to win and has gone up only 2lb for it, which I thought was fair. I'm hopeful he can add to his successes again this season [ran at Musselburgh on Tuesday night after the Weekender went to press]. 30-08-23

runners.comment: Placed on last couple of outings (7f/7.4f) and ought to give another good account here
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 7f in September (good/soft) and was placed on his last two appearances (7f/7.4f, good); does not appear to have much margin for error off current mark but ought to give another good account.

quotes.quote: I said to Connor [Beasley, jockey] that the last time Count Palatine ran we sat him handy and I didn't feel he enjoyed that so I said to just drop him in and ride him to finish. He liked the ground and did it well - Michael Dods, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.comment: Won three times on AW in late 2024 but has lost his way this year; had wind op in April
runners.spotlight: Won three times on Tapeta (7f-1m) towards end of 2024 but has lost his way this year; needs to have benefited from combination of wind surgery and two-month break.

stable_tour.quote: He's won his last two. He'll be entered on December 12 at Newcastle in a 0-78 and also on December 14 at Southwell n a 0-78 over a mile. I don't think he's stopped winning as he's been successful with a bit more up his sleeve. He's definitely one to follow for the all-weather. 05-12-24

runners.comment: Narrow 6f AW novice winner in February; up in trip for handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten in two 6f novice races for William Haggas in spring 2024 but led close home over that trip for new stable at Wolverhampton (AW) in February; absent since but open to further improvement in 7f handicaps.

runners.comment: Much better on AW; handicapped accordingly on turf but others appeal more all the same
runners.spotlight: Nine-time AW winner, the last twice over 7f this year; much less effective on turf and, although handicapped accordingly on this surface, others in this line-up appeal more.

runners.comment: Low-mileage 4yo; ran okay on AW last month but not yet proven on turf
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo; kept on well for fifth at Wolverhampton (7f, AW; first-time tongue-tie) last month but is yet to make any significant progress since winning a small-field 6f novice there on debut in January, and his worst run was his turf debut two starts ago.

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late J P Carrington

runners.comment: In frame on three of four AW starts since long absence but return to turf is not ideal
runners.spotlight: In the frame on three of four AW starts (all 7f) since returning in March from long absence but remains on a fairly tough mark and this return to turf is probably not ideal.

runners.comment: Unraced beyond 6f since 2yo season but comes here after a pretty good third last month
runners.spotlight: Unraced beyond 6f since 2yo season but came second over C&D on his debut and moves back up in trip after a pretty good third at Redcar (6f, good to firm) last month; no surprise if he features.

stable_tour.quote: We inherited him last backend and he grew and matured over the winter. His first run of the year at Doncaster was pretty solid and he finished third. He stepped forward from that at Thirsk last time, when he did everything wrong but still finished a close third. Only a neck separated him and the second and there was another neck to the winner.  If he'd done things right I'm sure he'd have won but he's just a big, raw, slow-maturing horse and I expect him to step forward quite considerably as the year goes on. He's better than his mark. He's entered at Doncaster on Friday. 28-06-24

runners.comment: Stayed on for third over 16 days ago; better suited by 7f now and well handicapped; player
runners.spotlight: Gained his last three wins over 7f; seemingly back in good form when staying-on third at Catterick (6f, good to soft) last month, his third run this season, and returns to 7f on a good mark; may well be the answer.

quotes.race: Congratulations Erin On Getting Married Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Patontheback had a lovely run round. I thought if he doesn't win today he's never going to as everything went perfect for him. He slid down to a handy mark, things haven't worked out his way but he hasn't done much wrong - Gemma Tutty, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He had a great time last year, winning twice over 7f and being placed on several other occasions. Hopefully he'll be able to ply his trade in the summer handicaps. He ran well on all sorts of different tracks last season, so we can be fairly flexible with him and he didn't run at all badly at Thirsk on Tuesday. 23-04-25

prev_owners.owner: D Fravigar, S Jones And Partner

runners.comment: Four-time 7f winner; in decent form over 1m this spring and recent 7f defeat is forgivable
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner over 7f; posted two pretty good efforts over 1m at Thirsk this spring and his recent 7f defeat is probably best overlooked (restless in stalls, awkward leaving stalls and then raced too freely); can bounce back and make his presence felt here.

runners.comment: Built upon a promising stable debut when emphatic winner at Leicester last month
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish filly who built upon her encouraging seasonal/stable debut (6f) when keeping on well for clearcut success in 16-runner Leicester handicap (7f, good to soft; blinkers removed) last month; 6lb higher in a higher-grade race here but the faster ground won't be a problem and she could have more to offer for Pam Sly.

racecards.betting_forecast: 7/2 Grand Citadel, 11/2 Count Palatine, 7/1 Wreck It Ryley,  Angel Of Rain,  Novello Lad,  Patontheback, 8/1 Wilde And Dandy, 12/1 Chifa, 14/1 Twilight Diamond, 16/1 Follow Your Heart, 20/1 Vibrato

racecards.race_name: Grace And Dotty Fedoras And Feathers Handicap (Div I)

runners.comment: Out of form when last seen in the autumn and still on a tough mark
runners.spotlight: Took form to whole new level when winning by 5l at Newmarket (7f, good) last summer but absent since some lesser efforts in the autumn and still on a fairly tough mark for this reappearance outing.

runners.comment: Ran very poorly on recent stable debut; first venture beyond 6f today
runners.spotlight: Very well handicapped on pick of last year's sprint form for Richard Spencer but last month's stable debut was very disappointing and he has stamina to prove on this first 7f attempt; headgear removed.

prev_owners.owner: Rasio Cymru 1 & Windmill House Tb Ltd

runners.comment: Did not get competitive at York last time but this dual C&D is on a very good mark now
runners.spotlight: Did not get competitive at York a fortnight ago but was unlucky not to finish much closer than ninth there (7f, good to firm) on his seasonal debut, and this dual C&D winner has slipped to a very tempting mark.

stable_tour.quote: He was placed in the Buckingham Palace for previous connections and has dropped down the handicap now. He had a few runs for us on slower ground but he wants it faster and could be well handicapped for the summer. He runs at Chelmsford on Thursday. 04-05-23

runners.comment: Unexposed filly who has shown clear promise on AW; switched to turf for handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Unexposed filly who made the frame on first two AW starts (7f/1m) and was very respectable fifth at Wolverhampton (8.6f) last month; open to improvement on this turf/handicap debut; one to consider.

runners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd
runners.comment: Comes here after two good efforts this spring and has each-way claims at least
runners.spotlight: Well beaten when tried in blinkers on seasonal debut but has posted two good efforts without headgear since, latterly when sixth of 21 at York (7f, good; denied clear run) a fortnight ago; each-way claims at least.

runners.comment: Largely consistent 6yo who went close in this race in 2024; probably won't be far away
runners.spotlight: Without a win since 2023 but this largely consistent 6yo has dropped another 1lb since last month's Beverley fourth (7.4f, good) and is now only 1lb higher than when going very close in a division of this race in 2024.

stable_tour.quote: He won very well at Haydock last year on his second start for us, then he wasn't quite right in the summer - there were a few in the yard under a bit of a cloud. We rested him quite early and he went back to his owner-breeder. He's back in training now and I see no reason why he can't build on that win at Haydock, where he looked like a horse with a lot of natural ability. 20-03-24

runners.comment: Multiple winner over this year; on a workable mark but didn't fire when last in action
runners.spotlight: 12 career wins, the latest at Bath (1m, firm) last month; also suited by 7f and remains on a workable mark but needs to rebound from a below-par run a fortnight ago.

quotes.quote: Thapa Vc is quite a tricky ride, he's got to be produced right, and Jim is just class - Mark Rimell, trainer.

runners.comment: AW winner in March; below form last month; still on tough mark for rare turf start
runners.spotlight: Won readily from off the pace on Tapeta at Newcastle (7f) in March but her run there last month was disappointing she is still on a fairly tough mark for this rare turf start.

quotes.quote: Too Much has done it nicely and hopefully she can progress. I don't think she's going to be a superstar but she's honest and tries hard so hopefully we can get another couple of numbers out of her - PJ McDonald, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.comment: 2-2 this season; up in grade today but still respected in current mood
runners.spotlight: Back in prime form this season, winning over C&D on reappearance in April and following up at Redcar (7f, also good to firm) last month; up in grade and on career-high mark today but still respected in current mood.

quotes.race: Watch Unbridled On attheraces.com Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: I felt Amayretto had more in her than she showed last year, or got to show last year, as she missed all the good rain in the spring because she picked up an injury. I thought another year would be a good idea, and hoped we might get a wet spring, but we didn't. I think, because of the breeze-ups, they've done a good amount of watering, so it was all right for her. Tim [Easterby, trainer] was very confident they would have watered enough and he was so right ? Deborah O'Brien, owners' representative.

runners.comment: Down the field on all three stable start but still worth a glance in the betting
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish 5yo; yet to add to his Galway maiden win in summer 2023 and has not threatened on any of three starts for new stable this year (7f-1m); still worth a glance in the betting, though.

quotes.quote: LIVIO MILO deserved it, he's very consistent and was second on his last three runs. He probably is better over a mile and that's why the plan was to push on and get first run. He battled hard and got a good ride. He is very versatile and that's his level - Dermot Weld, trainer.

runners.comment: Safely held in two 5f handicaps this season; now ventures beyond 6f for first time
runners.spotlight: Has modest 1-16 strike-rate, the win gained in three-runner maiden over 5f last summer; safely held in two handicaps over that trip this season and now ventures beyond 6f for the first time.

runners.comment: Placed over C&D in April but flopped on AW last month and is up in grade today
runners.spotlight: Scored at Wolverhampton (7f, AW) in April, his 11th start, and was placed over C&D (good to firm) on next outing but flopped when back on AW last month (raced too freely) and is up in grade today; others look stronger.

racecards.betting_forecast: 3/1 Amayretto, 9/2 Finbar's Lad, 11/2 Beattie Is Back, 6/1 Grace Taufan, 10/1 Riot,  Thapa Vc,  Diligent Henry, 16/1 Albeseeingyer, 20/1 Lucky Man,  Too Much,  Livio Milo, 25/1 Ticktyboo

racecards.race_name: Sky Bet Price Boosts Apprentice Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.comment: Six AW wins this year and won over hurdles in May; unproven on ground softer than good
runners.spotlight: Resurgent on AW in early part of this year, winning six times, and opened hurdling account in May; ran creditably over hurdles two weeks ago but he's unproven on ground softer than good.

runners.comment: Running creditably; well below form in September on his only two runs on softer than good
runners.spotlight: His second win last year came over C&D in June off 1lb lower; creditable third on both starts this season; well below form last September on his only two starts on softer than good.

runners.comment: Won 1m3f AW novice in December; he hasn't quite matched that form since
runners.spotlight: Won 1m3f AW novice in December; he hasn't quite matched that form since, returned to turf (1m1f here; first-time cheekpieces) for latest outing, and needs to better those efforts; unraced on softer than good.

runners.comment: Won comfortably in first blinkers last time; still well handicapped on 2023 and 2024 form
runners.spotlight: Tried this headgear for the first time at Chepstow (1m4f; just 3-1) 16 days ago and won comfortably under Ryan Kavanagh; up 6lb with a little more to prove on worse than good to soft but he's still well handicapped on 2023 and 2024 form.

runners.comment: Musselburgh 4th in April and fit from hurdling since; unraced on worse than good to soft
runners.spotlight: His last Flat win was in August 2023 but he did score over hurdles last July; fourth of 13 at Musselburgh this April puts him on the premises and he's fit from hurdling since; unraced on worse than good to soft.

quotes.quote: We were very disappointed last week at Carlisle so Doreen [Monteith, owner] said let's try Simple Star back over hurdles. He was a little star for us last year on the Flat. He came back this season and ran a great race at Musselburgh and then I think it was trainer error putting him into tracks that started with a downhill and he just got too keen. Hopefully, he'll be back at Musselburgh at the end of the Flat season - Dianne Sayer, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.comment: Won over 1m2f on Flat in May 2024 and over hurdles 18 days ago, both on good to soft
runners.spotlight: Won over 1m2f on Flat in May 2024 (4lb higher today) and over hurdles 18 days ago, both on good to soft; bit to prove if the ground is more testing but he's relatively lightly raced.

stable_tour.quote: He's done well from two to three. His first run last year was good as he finished third at Newcastle, one place behind a smart horse of Adrian Keatley's [Ballymount Boy]. He then went downhill because he was too weak, but he didn't run badly at Newcastle on Tuesday on his return. 03-04-24

runners.comment: 1m win this term; more to prove over this sort of trip and if the ground has gone testing
runners.spotlight: Won over 1m at Musselburgh (good) in April on seasonal debut, with a lesser show over 7f (good to firm) four weeks ago; more to prove over this sort of trip and if the ground has gone testing.

runners.owner: Mrs C M Clarke, Foulrice Park Racing Ltd
runners.comment: 4lb below last winning mark; interesting if back on ideal going, all wins on soft or heavy
runners.spotlight: Continues to edge down the weights and is 4lb below last winning mark; interesting if back on ideal ground, all wins having been on soft or heavy.

runners.comment: 4-14 here and he was bang there at this track over 1m3f and 1m5f on last two outings
runners.spotlight: Has won on heavy; 4-14 at this venue and he was bang there when taking minor honours here over 1m3f and 1m5f on last two outings; one of many each-way players in a hot race.

runners.comment: 10yo with 11 wins at Ayr, including from the front last three starts; last seen here 2022
runners.spotlight: 10yo who has won 11 times at Ayr, including from the front on last three starts, but latest of his three races at Hamilton (soundly beaten on last two occasions) was in 2022; placed on soft ground but has never won on it.

quotes.quote: I've won on Glasses Up a few times. We thought the mile might be short for him but he's proved us wrong. They went a good gallop and he picked up well - Paddy Mathers, jockey.

quotes.race: Get So Much More With Racing UK Handicap
quotes.quote: Glasses Up is just getting better and better and in time I'm sure he will step up to one and a half miles. His target is the Kilkerran Cup at the Gold Cup meeting - Mike Smith, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a super horse. When I bought him at the sales I was told I could spend £8k, maybe £10k at a push, and I rang the boys up and said, “I'm going to have to go to full budget for this.” The boys said, “Mike, that's a lot of money for a horse who hasn't run”, and I said “yes, but he's a cracking horse.” He was actually bought with an entry for the Derby. He's now won eight races for us and £121k in prize-money, so it was money well spent. The boys have turned down fairly good offers for him because they wanted to keep racing and having fun with him, which is commendable. He was a good third on his seasonal reappearance at Ayr behind Fiver Friday. He benefited from a racecourse gallop on the track after the Scottish National meeting, which is a fantastic thing and I think that's one of the reasons the Irish horses do so well. 16-05-24

runners.comment: Pontefract (1m2f, good) six days ago saw losing run broken in clearcut style under H Burns
runners.spotlight: Won the first and latest of his 20 races; the latter was at Pontefract (1m2f, good) six days ago when he came from last to first in eight-runner race and did it in clearcut style under Harry Burns; unraced beyond that but soft ground should be okay and he's one to consider under 5lb penalty.

stable_tour.quote: This colt made a winning start to his career when taking a mile maiden at Newbury, when I thought he had a good chance. Last time out I sent him to Newmarket for his handicap debut but the ground was too fast. When he won it was soft and we have learned that he must have plenty of give underfoot to be his best. I think he is on a nice mark (81) when the ground is right. 11-07-23

runners.comment: 6yo who is 0-10 (0-8 on the Flat); others have far more pressing claims
runners.spotlight: 6yo who is 0-10 (0-8 on Flat); close second of four when upped to 1m7f at Ayr four runs ago but not so good since; never dangerous at York Friday (1m2f); others have far more pressing claims, including on softer than good.

stable_tour.quote: I struggle to buy horses at the horses-in-training sales, but I bought him off Tom Malone. He ran well when second at Ayr last Thursday when just denied by a head. We're not sure about his trip as he was a hurdler we bought but we've handicapped him. We think he's a nice horse and I'll be disappointed if we don't win a few races with him, but I might have bought a hurdler. He's got ability and it's just finding the right trip for him. 07-05-25

runners.comment: Last 4 wins on heavy/soft, three in 2024 in cheekpieces (off this year); recent close 2nd
runners.spotlight: Five of ten wins have come over 1m2f at Beverley; last four wins have come on heavy and soft, three of them last year when wearing cheekpieces; they've been absent this year and, although she was a close second at Beverly last time, perhaps she'll be of more interest when they are refitted.

prev_owners.owner: M Tabor & D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & Westerberg

runners.comment: His mark continues to tumble but he's hard to fancy on this year's evidence
runners.spotlight: All three wins were in 2022 in his Irish days; his mark continues to tumble but he's hard to fancy on this year's evidence.

quotes.quote: I thought Cougar was very keen which wouldn't be like him. He jumped great and it's great to have a horse like him in the yard. He doesn't mind these  conditions and it is great that he won, I'm delighted to have him. Mark said he jumped well and he is improving all the time. He is a horse to look forward to - Paudie Roche, trainer
Cougar is an exciting horse to get. When he got going Mark said he really got the hang of it. It was a lovely introduction - Padraig Roche, trainer.

runners.comment: Second run for yard, and second on turf, was Carlisle win (1m3f, good to soft) latest
runners.spotlight: Trained last year by Charlie Fellowes; second run for her recent stable, and only her second on turf, when always prominent to win by a neck under Paula Muir at Carlisle (1m3f, good to soft) 16 days ago; 3lb higher today, in what looks a highly competitive race, but she's back into calculations.

racecards.betting_forecast: 11/2 Gallant Lion, 13/2 Spanish Hustle, 7/1 High Court Judge, 8/1 Clansman,  Golspie, 9/1 Terrorise,  Dandy's Angel, 10/1 Whathappensinvegas,  Glasses Up,  Idyllic, 12/1 Simple Star, 16/1 Izzari, 25/1 King Chaos, 33/1 Cascade Hall, 50/1 Cougar

racecards.race_name: Sky Bet Club Handicap

runners.comment: Ran creditably (third of 20) in first-time visor at York most recently; place claims
runners.spotlight: Seems to need good/firmer; ran creditably (third of 20) in first-time visor at York most recently; getting no help from the assessor but Warren Fentiman takes off useful 5lb; place possibilities.

runners.owner: Let's Be Lucky Racing 36 & David Carroll
runners.comment: Has never won when fresh but the Hamilton factor puts him in calculations; 3-4 here
runners.spotlight: Well suited by ground softer than good; comes with some risk on seasonal debut, having never won when fresh, but the Hamilton factor puts him firmly in calculations; 3-4 at this course.

stable_tour.quote: The key to him is soft ground and 6f is his best trip. He was tearing off in his races last season but he settles better now and is finishing his races. He bumped into one when he was second twice at Carlisle. The ground dried out too much for him at Pontefract last time. He was rated 76 but he's down to 62 now, so he's got a bit in hand. 26-07-24

runners.comment: Ex-Irish, twice-raced filly who is still unexposed; heed the market signals
runners.spotlight: Unexposed filly whose promise in Irish maidens for Andy Oliver comprised a close second at Down Royal (7f) and success at Navan (6f); this is harder but market support should be heeded.

quotes.quote: Unfortunately Sweet Thing had a wee setback earlier on in the year so it took a while to get her out, but we always liked her. She travels very well and behaves very well. She had a very nice run at Down Royal. The rain came and it literally went to quite testing ground, so she handled that but obviously inexperience beat her first-time out - Andy Oliver, trainer.

runners.breeder: Miss Nell Kent & Miss Sophie Bates
runners.comment: Fourth at York and successful at Ripon since wearing cheekpieces; may remain competitive
runners.spotlight: Sound performances since wearing cheekpieces, making the frame at York then winning narrowly at Ripon, both on good ground; back up 5lb but may remain competitive in the retained headgear.

quotes.quote: Hectic is very straightforward, he trains himself. We've made a lot of entries for him and when we've gone to declare we haven't. He was there to be shot at in front and there's a lot of improvement to come. Dobby loved him and said the ground didn't feel that quick on him; I'd say the ground's lovely. You might look at something like the Acomb, and he's very nice. He's a heavy-set, strong lad, so we'll have to be careful and I'd say he'd get seven furlongs no problem. That was probably quite a smart race - Richard Hannon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We struggled to get him back last year after he failed mentally to handle his second outing at York. He ran a super race in a Newbury handicap over seven furlongs on soft ground on his reappearance, though, and I think he'll be a lot better on a sounder surface and with that run under his belt. I was disappointed he went up 6lb, but I think he'll still be very competitive in good handicaps on his way to the Britannia. 02-05-23

Some of the horses just aren't getting their heads in front and this guy is one. He's taken a couple of runs to get fit this year but he's got them under his belt now. He ran a massive race to finish fourth at York last month under Hollie Doyle and we were pleased with that. Unfortunately at Doncaster on his next start, Kieran O'Neill dropped his reins in the last 100 yards and we were just beaten in a photo-finish by Silver Samurai. He might go to Pontefract on Sunday and he'll be a solid handicapper who'll go to the likes of York and be competitive - he was a good fifth there last weekend. 21-06-24

runners.comment: On a three-year losing spell and current mark reflects a decline in his form
runners.spotlight: Useful on his day; however, on a three-year losing spell and current mark reflects a decline in his form since last July; the betting may offer further guidance with Ripon reappearance under his belt.

quotes.quote: We are delighted with Mr Wagyu. His run shows he is back in form and he will win a good race soon. Jason (Hart) said that he coped with the ground, it was very, very soft. We are thinking about the Bold Lad at the Curragh where he was just beaten last year and he's also a course and distance winner there - John Quinn, trainer.

Mr Wagyu is a horse that comes to himself every June and July. We have a bit of a conundrum in September between the Ayr Gold Cup and the Bold Lad Handicap here so we will see - Sean Quinn, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet Stewards' Sprint Handicap (Consolation Race For The Stewards' Cup)
quotes.quote: We thought Mr Wagyu had enough on and his best form is on better ground but he's terribly versatile. This year he's found form he's never found before. The lads and lasses at home have done a great job with him. He doesn't take much or any training at all, he just loves to race - John Quinn, trainer.
Mr Wagyu travelled a bit too well early on as he was a bit keen, and then he idled once he got there. He's a horse with plenty of ability - Joe Fanning, jockey.

quotes.race: Smarkets Handicap (Jockey Club Grassroots Sprint Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Mr Wagyu was suited by this stiff 6f and it worked out well, as when he was headed he had something to aim at - Cameron Noble, rider.

quotes.race: Free Daily Tips On attheraces.com Handicap
quotes.quote: We knew coming in that Mr Wagyu loves the track as he has won here before, but I was worried about the draw in one. The visor has made him travel that bit sweeter - Jason Hart, jockey.
Mr Wagyu is a tough little horse, he keeps pulling it out -   John Quinn, trainer.
Mr Wagyu is a tough little horse.  He ran here first time and was a bit green. He's come on from that and appreciated the better ground - Jason Hart, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: Like Lord Riddiford, he's another who seems to have been around forever. He had a great season in 2022 and probably paid the price for it last year, running well in a lot of big handicaps and just coming up short. The handicapper has given him a chance now and he could still pay his way in 0-90s or 0-95s. 20-03-24

runners.breeder: Skymarch Farm Inc & Ecurie Des Charmes
runners.comment: Gained last five wins over 7f but went close on last 6f attempt; on a workable mark
runners.spotlight: Gained last five wins over 7f; beaten only 2l, despite traffic issues, at Musselburgh last weekend; drops back in distance but went close at Ayr on last 6f attempt; on a workable mark and not ruled out.

stable_tour.quote: He joined us earlier this month from Charlie Wallis and his first run at Musselburgh was very encouraging when third of 11 over 7f. He ran even better than that last week at Doncaster when beaten only one and a half lengths. For a horse who needs the race to be run at an end-to-end gallop he did not enjoy proceedings on Town Moor as they crawled most of the way before it developed into a sprint, so all things considered it was a fine effort. Both of his runs for me have been over 7f but I am trying him over a mile at Carlisle on Wednesday. His current mark of 73 is very fair and I would be very hopeful of him winning before long. 22-06-22

runners.comment: Still needs to prove she's fully effective on turf; peak form remains on AW
runners.spotlight: Stiff task in Listed grade last time; returns to a more suitable level but still needs to prove she's fully effective on turf; peak form remains on AW where she's a four-time winner.

runners.comment: Needs to improve on latest AW effort but is very well treated on best turf form
runners.spotlight: Made some late headway on AW last time when back from a layoff; needs to improve on that effort but is very well handicapped on best turf form, notably Glorious Goodwood win in 2023.

quotes.race: Coral Stewards' Sprint Handicap (Consolation Race For The Stewards' Cup)
quotes.quote: It's hard work, and I think it's not far off heavy ground, but Monsieur Kodi has shown he can handle it before so it was probably a bonus to us. The far rail is the freshest ground and if you can get an advantage anywhere it's on fresher ground, so we were aiming to get over there and it's worked out - Oisin Orr, jockey.

runners.comment: Overcame traffic issues to win 15-runner event over C&D last August; possibilities
runners.spotlight: Acts on any ground; well equipped for this assignment, having overcome traffic issues to win 15-runner event over C&D last August; steadily finding her form (over 7f) this term; possibilities.

runners.comment: 0-8 in handicaps but is nicely treated; close second off 5lb higher over C&D last June
runners.spotlight: Faded in the closing stages over 7f last weekend when back from a break; now 0-8 in handicaps but is well treated on best form, such as close second off 5lb higher over C&D last June.

runners.comment: Justified favouritism over C&D ten days ago; holds solid claims in current form
runners.spotlight: Versatile as regards ground; justified favouritism over C&D ten days ago, taking record in last four starts to 1221; upped in grade off career-high mark but holds solid claims in current form.

runners.comment: Close third off this mark in this race last year; down the field at York yesterday
runners.spotlight: Versatile as regards ground; ties in with Hectic on Ripon running this month; close third off this mark, despite traffic issues, in this race last year; down the field at York yesterday.

runners.comment: Most wins on soft/heavy; below par (bled from nose) on seasonal debut
runners.spotlight: Has registered most wins, including two at Hamilton, on soft/heavy; below par (bled from nose) on seasonal debut having been friendless in the betting; market may again prove helpful.

quotes.quote: In the middle of the summer Impressor had a couple of near misses, he nudged up a couple of pounds and then had a couple of poor efforts. We thought maybe his chance was gone, but he does like the ground and still seems quite well in himself - Phillip Makin, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

Impressor is an in-form horse at the moment and Phil's horses are flying. This lad loves the ground. Before when he used to get caught on a wing like that he wouldn't really battle hard for you but he's turned a corner and he dug deep when needed - Shane Gray, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: British EBF Molson Coors Novice Stakes (Plus 10 Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: Impressor has got loads of speed and I wouldn't be rushing to go over seven furlongs with him. He's in the Mill Reef at Newbury and that's a likely type of race to run him in - Marcus Tregoning, trainer.

prev_owners.owner: Mrs H Mannion, B Carter & F Durbin

runners.comment: Back up in trip he's not the percentage call, having gained all wins over 5f
runners.spotlight: Musselburgh success in April showed he retains plenty of gusto aged 11; however, back up in trip he's not the percentage call, having done all his winning over 5f.

quotes.quote: We had this planned a long way out and we had the best jockey in the north of Britain on - he doesn't panic. We were going to retire Only Spoofing last year but he's not one for that just yet. He's a tough nut and doesn't think he's 11 - Kevin Coleman, trainer.
Only Spoofing loves this track and trip. He cut out at Naas last day and back to five today suited him - Kevin Coleman, trainer.

quotes.race: Neptune Investment Management Supports Child Bereavement UK Handicap
quotes.quote: Only Spoofing is improving and came here in good form. He was great today and I think he could win a big one before the end of the year - Kieran O'Neill, jockey.

He can be very buzzy and went to the start early. Sean (Davis) had ridden him before and gave him a very brave ride. He's great value for his 7lb claim and you'd never think he was a claimer watching that ride. I'd imagine Only Spoofing will be coming back to Ireland before the end of the season - Tim Hogg, assistant to Jedd O'Keeffe, trainer of Only Spoofing.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De Saint-Vincent & E A R
runners.comment: Has won on turf but record suggests she may be better suited by AW these days
runners.spotlight: Has won on turf but record suggests she may be better suited by AW these days; form dipped returned to this sphere last time and now goes back into a tougher grade.

quotes.race: Fred Says Don't Fall 80th Birthday Handicap
quotes.quote: We loved Mersea at two and she got a little bit of an injury at York when she was giving weight to The Platinum Queen. She wasn't training with her usual exuberance earlier on in the year so we've been patient. We could see her drop back to five furlongs as she did everything wrong today - Sam's instructions were to sit fourth or fifth but he couldn't! I've got her pencilled in to return to Carlisle for a five-furlong race on September 1. I think she'll win again before the end of the year - Nick Bradley.

quotes.race: No.1 York By Guesthouse Hotels British EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mersea's attitude is probably her best attribute and she was never going to be beaten, I always had my rivals measure. It's so impressive she's that tough, especially as a juvenile - Sam James, jockey

stable_tour.quote: I thought a lot of her last year when she managed to win back-to-back races at Carlisle and York, where she defied a 6lb penalty. Things didn't fall right in her first three runs this year as she was outpaced at York and then at Doncaster the ground was too soft. However, she had been showing me shades of the old Mersea at home in recent weeks and I felt she had a big shout last week at Carlisle. She set off at the front and quickened nicely 2f out to win by three-quarters of a length. She looked like a 5f horse in a 6f race and we got away with it. She's in at Carlisle on Friday over 5f with a penalty and this would be her last chance for a while to run in a 0-75, so if the ground is riding fast I think she'll go there. She's still on a very nice mark. 30-08-23

racecards.betting_forecast: 5/1 Sir Garfield, 6/1 Abduction, 8/1 Rock Opera,  Hectic,  Rock Melody,  Cargin Bhui,  Sacred Falls, 12/1 Sweet Thing, 14/1 Hour By Hour,  Mr Wagyu, 16/1 Brazilian Rose,  Monsieur Kodi,  Only Spoofing, 20/1 Impressor, 25/1 Mersea

racecards.race_name: Sky Bet Proud To Support ROR Fillies' Handicap

runners.comment: Took well to first-time cheekpieces at Carlisle; respected in the retained headgear
runners.spotlight: Seems versatile as regards ground; record is 3-17; took well to first-time cheekpieces at Carlisle (1m) most recently and may have more to offer in the retained headgear; respected.

quotes.quote: Zapphire is not winning out of turn. She's not entirely straightforward but she has a decent level of ability. I popped her in a fillies' handicap in a fortnight at Leopardstown and that might be interesting. She loves soft ground so if it rained over there we'd be even happier - Steve Brown, trainer's husband and assistant.
I'm pleased with that. Zapphire has definitely got ability and she's done that well but she can be a bit of a madam - Julie Camacho, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She belongs to the Elite Racing Club and is a talented filly who can be a little temperamental at times. The handicapper was kind to her after her Haydock win last month as the front two were three lengths clear of the rest. She's in good form and is ready to run again soon, preferably with some cut in the ground. 06-09-23

runners.comment: Lightly raced 4yo; quite interesting back on turf with AW reappearance under her belt
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo who has shown fairly useful form at Newmarket (soft/heavy) on two occasions; quite interesting returned to turf with AW reappearance under her belt.

runners.comment: Southern raider; on a near two-year losing spell but is well handicapped on best form
runners.spotlight: Acts on good to soft; southern raider who is on a near two-year losing spell but is attractively handicapped on best form and this first visit to Scotland may well be the time to catch her.

quotes.quote: Roarin' Success had a little niggle at the beginning of the year so we've taken out time with her. I thought she'd need that on that ground, so I'm nicely surprised with that performance. We'll stick to a mile and find another handicap - Harry Charlton, joint-trainer.

runners.comment: Bounced back to form with Doncaster success nine days ago; may remain competitive
runners.spotlight: Yet to race on softer than good; bounced back to form with Doncaster success (1m) nine days ago, taking record to 2-11; may remain competitive, despite going back up 4lb.

runners.comment: May do better back on grass; last three turf attempts comprised two wins and a second
runners.spotlight: Out of the frame in AW events this year but may do better back on turf; last three attempts in this sphere have resulted in form figures of 112, albeit over longer distance.

runners.comment: The sole C&D winner in this field and ran creditably back in this scenario ten days ago
runners.spotlight: Versatile as regards ground; record is 2-14; the sole C&D winner in this field and ran creditably when returned to this scenario ten days ago; on a workable mark and has solid claims.

runners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Al Maktoum
runners.comment: Form dipped sharply on reappearance, having been friendless in the betting
runners.spotlight: Record of 2-3 last term; form dipped sharply on reappearance eight days ago, having been friendless in the betting; best watched unless the market signals go the other way.

quotes.race: Ire-Incentive, It Pays To Buy Irish EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Bassadanza is quite a fiery character at home, our early experiences suggest that comes from the stallion and quite a few of his progeny seem to be quite hot. She was quite green and raw through the race but I think she won with a bit more in hand than the margin would suggest. I probably wouldn't be rushing her back, in light of her temperament. I'd like to let this initial experience sink in - Charlie Johnston, trainer.

runners.comment: Handicap debutante who is open to progress, provided she stays this new trip
runners.spotlight: Thrice-raced filly who has shown fair form at about 7f, notably Beverley 2yo success; open to progress now handicapping, provided she stays this new trip; unexposed and interesting.

runners.comment: Won at Hamilton last June and Ayr last month; faces a stiffer task upped in class
runners.spotlight: Unraced on soft/heavy; versatile sort who gained her wins over 1m3f at Hamilton last June and 1m at Ayr last month; however, faces a stiffer task off new mark upped in class.

runners.comment: Has question marks over current form and the new trip
runners.spotlight: Disappointing over 7f last weekend (second run for new yard) having been 1-1 at the distance previously; has question marks over current form and this new trip.

quotes.race: Enterprising Women Eileen & Jean Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Hackney Diamonds broke smartly and the tailwind behind us took me through the last furlong. I felt like I was on fumes but she was tough and managed to fend them off - Billy Loughnane, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

racecards.betting_forecast: 4/1 Zapphire,  Roarin' Success, 9/2 Epidavros, 13/2 Viennoise,  Surprised, 9/1 Lunar Eclipse, 10/1 Typical Woman, 12/1 Hackney Diamonds, 16/1 Bassadanza, 20/1 Penelope's Sister

racecards.race_name: Sky Bet Build A Bet Handicap

runners.comment: In great form since dropped to 5f, winning at Ascot then second at Haydock; respected
runners.spotlight: Only 1-10 over 6f; in great form since dropped to 5f, winning at Ascot then close second at Haydock, both on good to firm ground (has form on soft); could well have more to offer at this distance; respected.

runners.comment: Steadily back to form this term, second at York most recently; still on workable mark
runners.spotlight: All turf wins on good/firmer; steadily back to form this season, keeping-on second at York (good) most recently; remains on a workable mark and enters calculations.

stable_tour.quote: He was getting away with 5f when he was better handicapped, but I think 6f is probably his trip now. He was drawn out on a limb at Newcastle on Good Friday but led for a long way and I thought he ran very well. We'll look to freshen him up for the turf now. 04-04-24

He was a little unfortunate not add to his wins when beaten a nose by Gale Force Maya at the Craven meeting in the spring. He did not run too badly at Epsom this month and is on a mark he will remain competitive off and should be out again in the next fortnight. 15-06-22

runners.comment: Needs to rebound from a below-par effort last time; 2-2 on heavy ground
runners.spotlight: Five-time winner, most recently off 1lb lower in April; needs to rebound from a below-par effort last time; has form on all types of ground but is a notable 2-2 on heavy.

quotes.quote: Trilby shows nothing at home. He's so laid-back for a sprinter. He's a pleasure to deal with and, because he's so easy and rideable, he just saves himself, which is great. He's been a great horse for us so far, so anything else he achieves is a bonus. He likes Haydock, and we all like a day out at York, so fingers crossed we'll keep tipping away with him. It will be fun to see what the season brings - Sam England, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Sam: He's been a cracking buy for 2,000gns. He's best on a stiff sprint track.  Jonathan: He was a little disappointing last time in an amateur riders' race on the all-weather, but I think he's probably better on turf. He was unlucky not towin at Pontefract previously, he got there and pricked his ears in front and got caught. 08-02-24

runners.comment: Disappointing last time when bidding for hat-trick, and remains on career-high mark
runners.spotlight: Disappointing last time when bidding for hat-trick, and remains on career-high mark; on the plus side, Warren Fentiman takes over and claims a useful 5lb.

quotes.quote: Reigning Profit was a bit slower away than we'd hoped but it worked out well in the end. He likes it here - Ruth Carr, trainer.

quotes.race: Ripon Races Ladies Day 22nd June Handicap
quotes.quote: He did it well. Reigning Profit broke very quickly so I travelled strongly through the race and I think he was just getting a little tired near the line - James Sullivan, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Go Racing In Yorkshire Future Stars Apprentice Handicap (Round 3)
quotes.quote: Reigning Profit is usually a good eater and he's a solid sprinter so I see no reason why he shouldn't go to Goodwood on Friday - Ruth Carr, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A solid sprinter who had a busy 2024 running 20 times, scoring at Wolverhampton and Hamilton and finishing runner-up four times. A turning track over 5f suits him best. There's a race for him at Pontefract on April 14. 09-04-25

runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd And Partner
runners.comment: Has gained both handicap wins on soft; would be interesting when back on that surface
runners.spotlight: Campaigned on good/firmer this term, finishing second twice; would be particularly interesting when back on soft ground, having gained both handicap wins on that surface.

quotes.race: cavani.co.uk Glorious Gallop Gala Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: William (Pyle) said Curious River took him there and did it easily. He's won a couple of races now and seems to be getting quicker - Katie Scott, trainer.

quotes.race: Dave Watson Memorial/EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (For horses In Bands C & D) (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Curious Rover is a nice horse. He didn't show as much speed as that when we first got him so we started him off over a bit further but he's probably a right sprinter. He's learned his job nicely and progressed each time so it's perfect. We'll probably look for something under a penalty now, he's going to get a stiff enough mark - Katie Scott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A very fast gelding who won twice as a two-year-old and this season ran an absolute cracker when fifth in the 3YO Dash at Epsom on Derby day behind Blue Storm, proving that he has trained on. He was just a bit lost for a few seconds in the dip and lost momentum. Without that he could have been third, but it was still a huge run and he now goes to Chester at the end of the month - he'll take some stopping provided he gets a good draw. 14-06-24

runners.comment: Suited by slow ground; won well at Chester yesterday; major player under 5lb penalty
runners.spotlight: Suited by ground softer than good; recorded a 3l win over 6f at Chester yesterday (fourth run for new stable) and looks favourably treated under 5lb penalty; effective at 5f and has to be feared.

runners.comment: Ran creditably in the Dash at Epsom last weekend; possibilities back down in class
runners.spotlight: Five wins last autumn; ran creditably in the Dash at Epsom (good) last weekend; has form on most ground but is a notable 2-3 on heavy; possibilities back down in grade.

quotes.race: Download The At The Races App Apprentice Handicap (Hands And Heels Race) (Part Of The RE Series)
quotes.quote: Marching Mac is a five-furlong horse now and the stiff trip got him beat yesterday. He's a little bit keen and we had to hold on to him whereas back here in this sort of race, we can let him bowl along. Grace [McEntee] rides out at George's every day and she stuck Fred up for the ride. This horse came from George's as well so there's a lot of George Boughey connection there. He's entered at Chelmsford on Saturday in a 58 handicap because I knew he was 60 yesterday, the handicapper put him up for getting beat last week. Now I can run in a 58, rated 62 with no penalty for winning a kids' race. It's just stuff I love to do -  trainer Phil McEntee speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.comment: Bids for £100,000 bonus, having won Sunday Series events the last twice; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Bids for £100,000 bonus, having made all in Sunday Series events at Newmarket (good to firm) and Chelmsford (AW) the last twice; Archie Young takes off handy  5lb; shortlisted.

stable_tour.quote: He's now won his last two at Pontefract and then at Lingfield last Thursday. His work has always been good and he finished fourth at York in a big-field handicap last season. But he then went wrong and we only ran him three times in all last year. He had to have time off and then he had a wind op during the winter. He's slowly run himself into form this season. Archie Young has won on him twice now and gave him an excellent ride at Pontefract. Both the horse and jockey had to be tough at Lingfield last time and they got the job done. I'd like to think there's be a little bit more to come from him. Whether he gets the hat-trick up depends on how good his trainer is. 28-06-24

runners.comment: Close third over C&D last time; versatile and largely progressive; holds solid claims
runners.spotlight: Prolific sprinter on AW in winter/spring and scored over 7f on turf in May; close third over C&D (good) most recently; versatile and largely progressive sort who has solid claims.

quotes.quote: I thought Oriental Prince had just held on. The race set up nicely, he relaxed and I was able to get a breather into him. He hasn't stopped improving yet - Paul Mulrennan, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's had a brilliant all-weather season. We're at a crossroads with him because we're not sure if he's done enough or not, or if we need to change tactics. He's hard to catch on the all-weather but the turf is slightly different to the all-weather and we're not sure if we're going too hard or not hard enough. He's still quite an exciting horse. If you look at the sectionals at Musselburgh in a very strong race last month it was very good. We probably used up a lot of petrol with Gweedore and I think if we'd have been left alone then we'd have been first or second. That's Ayr Gold Cup form and we're taking on Class 2 handicappers, so he's interesting. He's obviously very fast. 07-05-25

runners.comment: Held by Solar Aclaim on Chester running yesterday
runners.spotlight: Scored over C&D two years ago but has gained all five subsequent wins at Chester/Catterick; something to find on 2024 form, most recently behind Solar Aclaim yesterday.

quotes.race: EMS Copiers Supporting Kildare Chamber Maiden
quotes.quote: Count D'Orsay is very hard to place over five furlongs here. He goes to the July sales now and is probably off a very good mark looking at that - Charles O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He loves soft ground and I'll definitely try him over an easy six furlongs this season; he runs through the line well over five. He ran really well over five and a half in the Portland last year and that will be a good race for him again. 02-05-22

runners.comment: Below best this term but could revive off a handy mark; won over C&D last June
runners.spotlight: Acts on slow ground; below best this term but has become favourably handicapped, being 2lb below last winning mark; scored over C&D last June and could revive.

quotes.race: tote On The Go At tote.co.uk Racing League 18 Handicap (Trainers Reg' To Racing League)
quotes.quote: Manila Scouse probably just likes the rain and the uphill finish, because he stays six [furlongs] so he travels really strong as well and gets through the line strong - David Allan, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Sunday Series Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Manila Scouse ran a blinder last week and the drop back to five really suited him. He stays it really well, especially in that ground. He's very game and stuck on well in the last furlong - Oliver Stammers, jockey.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Manila Scouse loved this ground and the tongue-tie helped as well - Paul Mulrennan, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He had time off as a three-year-old, we couldn't train him, but he came back really well last season. He wants five furlongs with some cut. He was entered at Newmarket, but the ground was advertised as fast so I didn't declare him, although it actually would have been all right. 23-04-24

runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: Gained last three wins at Musselburgh; below par in both attempts at Hamilton
runners.spotlight: Gained last three wins at Musselburgh, the most recent off 2lb lower in April; below par in both attempts at Hamilton; not the percentage call.

quotes.quote: It worked out well. I haven't a clue why Zarzyni won there, we've tried everything with him. He's very smart, but I don't think the horse knows he's won. If he had time to think he'd have got beaten. He's a handy type to have in the yard as he's a very good work horse. When we have sprinters we have to work, he's the boy. We're thankful he's won and Musselburgh's been a lucky place for us -  oint-trainer David Barron, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Zarzyni is very straightforward and had been working well. For one of ours to win first time is always a good sign. We thought he was up to winning a maiden but not necessarily first time - Michael Halford, trainer.

runners.comment: Dual winner over C&D but faces a stiffer task in this field
runners.spotlight: Dual winner over C&D but appears to have a stiffer task in this field and needs to leave his Carlisle reappearance effort well behind too.

quotes.race: cavani.co.uk The Dapper Dash For Cash Handicap
quotes.quote: Alex gave Never Dark a really good ride. He had a feather weight and not many jockeys can do that weight so we were looking for a good apprentice who can claim. And he gave him a lovely, straightforward ride. We had him in at Ripon as well but it's undulating there and it doesn't suit every horse. The key to this horse is he handles dig in the ground and he's come to himself this year. He seems to have found a bit of confidence - Iain Jardine, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet Thanks The Frontline Workers Handicap
quotes.quote: Never Dark jumped really well and never saw another rival after that. He's pretty sensible within himself and could go back over six but I'd like to see him running over five furlongs on the grass. The whole family all progressed with age and over the winter he has strengthened, and I would imagine he'll take a big step forward - David Probert, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's a really quick horse. He's big and takes a bit of time to get right but once you get him to full fitness he's very consistent. He won at Nottingham and then his next run at York maybe came too soon, the ground was also a bit tacky. There are plenty more nice races in him. 26-07-24

runners.comment: Has gradually lost his form since winter AW win; opposed
runners.spotlight: Has gradually lost his form since winter AW win and latest defeat took his turf record to 0-12; opposed.

quotes.race: Top Odds Every Day With BetUK Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I think Brooklyn Nine Nine just got a bit tired the last half furlong but he got the job done. I started on the outside rail but he just drifted a bit left and I think he got a bit lonely.
