His two runs last year were very good and I think he needed that today so he's going to come on a bit for it - Oisin Orr, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.owner: D B & Mrs C Lamplough & Partner
runners.comment: In-form contender who won at Catterick most recently; 1-1 over C&D; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Steps up two grades but receives weight all round and he's an in-form contender who won, albeit narrowly, at Catterick (good to soft) most recently; 1-1 over C&D; shortlisted.

racecards.betting_forecast: 9/2 Blue Day, 13/2 Marching Mac, 8/1 Bergerac,  Spring Is Sprung,  Oriental Prince, 9/1 Solar Aclaim,  Albegone, 10/1 Curious Rover, 12/1 Trilby,  Reigning Profit, 14/1 Manila Scouse,  Zarzyni, 25/1 Count d'Orsay,  Never Dark, 33/1 Brooklyn Nine Nine

racecards.race_name: Sky Bet, For The Fans Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.comment: None of his turf form (the best of it last term was on heavy) approaches this mark
runners.spotlight: Scored on AW in December and April, latterly over 1m6f, before another good AW run in May; AW form was not transferred, however, when 11th of 14 at Haydoock (1m4f, good) 15 days ago and none of his turf form (the best of it last term was on heavy) approaches this mark.

runners.comment: Creditable reappearance but last next time; something to prove on worse than good to soft
runners.spotlight: Usually front-runner; last season's two wins (1m4f in April and September) came in small fields; in the form of his life in the autumn and creditable fifth of 14 at Musselburgh (1m6f) on reappearance, but he was last of 12 at York on latest outing; something to prove on worse than good to soft.

runners.comment: AW debut (Newcastle win) was a significant advance and he's now gone back up 7lb
runners.spotlight: 1-5 for Richard Hannon and now 1-4 for current yard after prevailing in good style at Newcastle (1m4f, AW debut) five weeks ago; seemed to act on a range of ground on turf before that (won a maiden on heavy) but that AW run was a significant advance and he's now gone back up 7lb.

stable_tour.quote: We were very pleased with his run at Newbury the other day. I wish I had the guts to tell Sean to make the running as he would have gone very close. As he steps up to a mile and a half, maybe even a mile and six furlongs, you'll see the best of him. He's a very likeable horse. 29-04-24

runners.comment: Perhaps the November Handicap is best forgiven and he could resume improvement
runners.spotlight: Three wins last term, convincingly when upped to 1m6f at Haydock (heavy) and York (soft) in the autumn; made the running on second occasion but that did not work in the 1m4f November Handicap at Doncaster (just 7-1) on final outing; perhaps that's best forgiven and he could resume improvement.

quotes.quote: That's a great prize to win. Minstrel Knight has been very consistent and he loves this type of ground. He's done that really well. He's in the Horses In Training sale but I need to talk to the owner - Ed Bethell, trainer.

runners.comment: On a major roll; strong run collared Savrola close home over C&D last time; acts on soft
runners.spotlight: Last season ended with two big runs on soft ground and he's carried on the good work this term with wins at Southwell (1m4f, AW) and Hamilton (1m5f, good); raised another 5lb but produced a strong and well-timed run to collar Savrola close home last time and has more to give; big shout.

runners.comment: Much more competitive again when close third at Chester (1m4f, good) on latest start
runners.spotlight: Trained in 2023 and 2024 by Ollie Sangster; new yard this season, much more competitive again when close third of ten at Chester (1m4f, good) last time; one of his 2yo wins was on soft; back in the each-way picture.

stable_tour.quote: I had him in a Listed race at Haydock last Saturday but I didn't run him and I'm now looking at the Champagne and the Royal Lodge - he's probably going to go up to a mile next time. He wasn't that expensive, but he's a big horse and he's shown up well since the spring. We rather expected him to do what he did first time out at Chepstow and then he won easily at Ffos Las. He's only going to improve as he still has plenty of learning to do and I think he's going to be a better horse next year, when he'll probably want a mile and a quarter. I've raced him in relatively Mickey Mouse races so it's hard to get a guide as to how good he is, but I hope he'll do well for the winter. He'll be a stakes horse. 12-09-23

runners.comment: Caught close home by King's Scholar over C&D latest and clearly one to take seriously
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in 2022 on his only run on soft; won at Musselburgh (1m4f, good to soft) on final start last season and easily made all at Thirsk (1m6f, good) on reappearance; gave his rivals the slip 3f out over C&D (good) 18 days ago, only to be caught by King's Scholar close home and raised another 3lb but he's clearly one to take seriously.

quotes.quote: We've struggled to find the key with Savrola but Paul [Mulrennan, jockey] obviously found that key - Dianne Sayer, trainer.

runners.owner: J S Morrison & Ms Carol Morrison
runners.comment: Three wins last summer (1m3f-2m1f) and he's now 2lb below his last winning mark
runners.spotlight: Acts on good to soft, unraced on worse; three wins last summer (1m3f-2m1f) and he's now 2lb below his last winning mark; penultimate outing was best run this term and he could do without one of his slow starts; beaten 18l in the King's Scholar C&D race latest.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Build A Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: Letsbefrank is getting very lethargic in his races and he was never on the bridle. He's tough and game, but the Johnston horse got a soft lead and you know they'll always keep going. But this horse keeps digging, he's tough. I'm lucky I'm the one pointing him, but this has been the plan for Jim and his team since the winter. He's had all the races mapped out, credit to him. To win one race is hard but to win three takes some doing - Paul Mulrennan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's been frustrating at the start of this year. We did such a good job with him last year, so it just swings and roundabouts. We've given him a couple of runs and he was a little bit better at Thirsk, but he was still playing games. I've taken my foot off the accelerator a bit and we're treating him for ulcers and various health things. He had quite a hard season last year so maybe we're paying for it, but I'm sure he'll bounce back. He's still got an engine. 07-05-25

runners.comment: Disappointing sort; wind surgery before latest start;  tongue-tie returns; first blinkers
runners.spotlight: Disappointing sort who ended up 12l behind King's Scholar here last time, following wind surgery; now has a tongue-tie (tried on final start last term) and first-time blinkers.

quotes.quote: That was a good performance. Forza Orta had looked a bit one-paced over shorter distances so we decided to try something different. He got the trip well, we always thought he would eventually, and that opens an awful lot of avenues to us - Kevin Ryan, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We're aiming him at the Chester Cup but he'll probably need to win before then to get in. He travels strongly in his races, stays well and it would be lovely to get him into a race like that. We can look at all those staying races this season. 04-04-24

He is a very consistent gelding having finished in the first three in nine of his ten starts. Hamilton clearly suits him with both of his successes to date at the Scottish track, including last month over 1m5f. Last time out at Haydock he travelled like the winner but when he was let down on the quick ground it was too fast for him. He has an entry in the Duke of Edinburgh at Royal Ascot, although he may not get in off his mark. Should that be the case we will find him another race soon and I feel he is definitely going the right way. 15-06-22

runners.comment: Did well here last term, not this season; at least she's now back to her last winning mark
runners.spotlight: Five wins last year, three of them here (1m5f/1m4f, various ground); no impact this season and the last three of those runs were at this track, but at least she is now back to her last winning mark.

quotes.race: Racecourse Live Streams On Racing TV Extra Handicap
quotes.quote: Tafsir is a well-bred filly so it's good to get a win, but Paul's given her an absolute peach of a ride. He's gone down the brave man's route down the inside rail and has won quite comfortably in the end. She'll win again, especially with the assistance of Paul. He's top-class - Jim Goldie, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's challenging but she always has been. It's always been onwards and upwards with her and she has her own way of doing things. She probably needs to race herself fit. She probably needs a couple of runs to get there. It could have been a blindfold issue on her penultimate start and she doesn't make it easy for the jockeys as she knows the rhythm of the stalls and she starts to mess about - she plays games. She couldn't make an impression behind Faylaq at Hamilton last time. She was probably the cheapest of Hamdan's cast-offs and it looked like they were right, but now she's won more races than most of them. He bred her to be better than 78, so we don't know if her mark is too high. 07-05-25

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late K Abdullah

runners.comment: Respectable C&D fifth to King's Scholar; 2025 form on good to soft is bit better than that
runners.spotlight: Has done well this term under claimer Mason Paetel; respectable fifth to King's Scholar over C&D (good) on penultimate start and this season's form on good to soft is a bit better than that; won on soft in 2024; considered.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Build A Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: Destinado is a very tough horse who's been very consistent since he joined James. This is his trip, he broke well and travelled nicely throughout the race - Aidan Keeley, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely little horse who helped to put us on the map. He went off the boil a bit but ran really well again when he was third at Southwell just before Christmas. Unfortunately, when he won at Lingfield a few starts back, he won by too far, so he shot up in the handicap and we're just having to fight that a little bit at the moment. 01-01-25

runners.comment: Lightly raced; unraced on softer than good; cheekpieces (tried once, runner-up) return
runners.spotlight: Second at Kempton (1m4f, AW; first-time cheekpieces) last October on third run for the Gosdens and sold for 30,000gns that month; both runs this season were C&D, fairly encouraging on first occasion but never dangerous behind King's Scholar on latest; unraced on softer than good; cheekpieces return.

stable_tour.quote: He's one we have from John and Thady Gosden and he could potentially be nice - he showed some promise behind Faylaq at Ayr on Sunday. He's big, 16.3hh, and a late-maturing type. He's not very quick but they don't need to be if they keep galloping. 07-05-25

racecards.betting_forecast: 5/2 King's Scholar, 5/1 Savrola, 11/2 Sam Hawkens, 8/1 Minstrel Knight, 9/1 Per Contra,  Destinado, 12/1 Steel Tiger,  La Pulga, 14/1 Letsbefrank,  Alnayef, 20/1 Forza Orta, 25/1 Tafsir

racecards.race_name: Sky Bet Extra Places Every Day Handicap

runners.comment: May need ground softer than good; not fully exposed; refitting of hood looks a plus
runners.spotlight: Below par on good ground last time (handicap debut) and may need softer; gelded since; gained his 2yo win in hood and looks interesting with this headgear reapplied; has low mileage and isn't fully exposed.

stable_tour.quote: He's well bred and at some stage I'd imagine we'll campaign him to try to get some black type for his mare, rather than himself. He'll handle cut in the ground over six or seven furlongs and I'm hopeful he can have a good year. 09-04-25

runners.owner: N Skinner D Jenkins T Goodair J Glover
runners.comment: Defied top weight in C&D contest last month, beating a subsequent dual scorer (pair clear)
runners.spotlight: Defied top weight in similar event over C&D (good) last month, holding on narrowly from a subsequent dual scorer (pair clear) and taking record to 2-7; very solid kept to same scenario and warrants respect up 6lb.

runners.comment: Both wins over 5f at turning Chester; enough to prove over this straight, stiff 6f
runners.spotlight: Has raced exclusively over 5f and gained both wins at tight, turning Chester; below form in both runs this term and has enough to prove over this straight, stiff 6f.

runners.comment: Hit with 8lb rise for Windsor win but largely consistent and should be thereabouts
runners.spotlight: Yet to race on ground softer than good; successful at Windsor (6f) with reappearance under his belt, taking record to 2-8; has to overcome an 8lb rise but is largely consistent and likely to be thereabouts.

runners.comment: 2-2 since upped to 6f, both wins last autumn; open to further progress at this trip
runners.spotlight: Two from two since upped to 6f, winning at Haydock (heavy) and Doncaster (soft) last autumn; open to further progress over this distance and has possibilities on reappearance, especially if the mud is flying.

runners.comment: Form has dipped sharply this term; best watched unless the market speaks favourably
runners.spotlight: Scored twice on good ground last summer and ran well on AW in the autumn; form has dipped sharply this term and he's best watched unless the market suggests a revival is likely.

quotes.race: Paula Budge Surprise Birthday Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Lesley's Boy did well to win because he didn't really handle the track. I was off the bridle for most of the way, it was probably his ability that got him through today. It's a hard track, there are plenty of undulations but it worked out okay for me. He's improving with racing and I hope he keeps going the right way - Oisin Orr, jockey.

runners.comment: Ran as if something was amiss last time; pedigree suggests he should do better still
runners.spotlight: Novice promise (6f) comprised a win at Thirsk and close third at Doncaster; ran as if something was amiss in handicap since; half-brother to a prolific winner for his connections and may do better still.

runners.comment: One of only two C&D winners in the field; interesting returned to this scenario
runners.spotlight: Steadily progressive as a 2yo until facing difficult tasks in the autumn; one of only two C&D winners in the field and looks interesting returned to this scenario with Thirsk reappearance (5f) under her belt.

stable_tour.quote: She's a nice filly. She ran at Redcar first time when she was second, and then won at Catterick despite not handling the track.  Both those runs were over 5f and she then went to Hamilton, stepping up to 6f, and put up a good display there, winning again. With racing she's sharpened up a bit and two starts ago at Haydock, when she was third, she ran well in quite a decent race won by Qaseem. I felt that she's speeded up, so I dropped her back to 5f on Sunday at Beverley and she ran a cracker to finish second, beaten only a neck by Mission Command. She was unlucky as she just didn't get the gap when she needed it. I'm not sure where she'll go next, but it'll probably be a stiff 5f or 6f. 28-08-24

runners.comment: Form figures read 233; may be capable of progress in handicaps; solid contender
runners.spotlight: Has made a consistent start to his career, having produced form figures of 233, all over 6f; may be capable of progress in handicaps and, all things considered, looks a solid contender.

runners.comment: Off the mark in Pontefract event on last attempt at this distance; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Shaped encouragingly at York (7f) on stable/seasonal debut while leaving the impression this return to 6f will suit; off the mark in autumn Pontefract event (soft) on last attempt at this trip; not ruled out.

quotes.race: Constant Security Serving Yorkshire Racecourses Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: It's quite satisfying to get Veydari's head in front. He's been hard work and the guys at Richard's (Fahey) yard have done a fabulous job with him. He's not easy to manage, he's quite tough and hard on himself, but he's obviously gelded and that's definitely helped - James Doyle, jockey speaking to Racing TV

prev_owners.owner: Moulton Racing And C J Murfitt

runners.comment: Doesn't appear to be crying out for this drop in trip on stable/seasonal debut
runners.spotlight: Showed ability over 7f/1m last year for Tom Clover, without shaping as if he's crying out for this drop to sprinting; gelded over the winter and sold for 8,000gns last month; the betting may offer further guidance.

runners.comment: Rallied for close sixth in better race at Epsom last weekend; open to improvement
runners.spotlight: Four-race maiden who has shown promise in two notable contests, latest at Epsom (5f) last weekend when rallying for close sixth; open to improvement back up in trip and back down in grade; one to consider.

runners.comment: Maiden who has shown best form over 1m; enough to prove back down in trip
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish maiden who has shown best form over 1m; disappointing favourite at Carlisle most recently, failing to back up Doncaster effort; enough to prove back down 2f in distance.

stable_tour.quote: We're still learning about him. He's quite big and probably didn't handle Musselburgh that well and was a little bit unlucky as he got a bump at the wrong time. He got closer at Doncaster when second on Saturday when he ducked right when challenging. Hopefully he'll be a player in a similar race soon. 07-05-25

runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd And Partner
runners.comment: Took his handicap form to a new level last month; may improve further; not dismissed
runners.spotlight: Took his handicap form to a new level last month, finishing second over C&D (good to firm) then opening his account in Ripon contest (6f, good to soft); upped in class but may improve further; shortlisted.

racecards.betting_forecast: 7/2 Lord Roxby, 13/2 Station X,  Glorious Kitty, 8/1 Far Above The Law,  Tarlac, 10/1 Cabelleroso,  U Sure Do,  Veydari, 12/1 Educating Rita, 14/1 Alpha Magic, 20/1 Lesley's Boy,  Beechdale, 25/1 Fuji Mountain,  Native Honey

racecards.race_name: Enter ITV7 For Free EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Made pleasing debut when keeping-on second of ten at Pontefract; strong claims
runners.spotlight: Out of a useful 1m 2yo winner; race a bit too freely but still made very pleasing debut when keeping-on second of ten at Pontefract (6f, good to firm) last month; makes obvious appeal here.

runners.comment: 33-1 for recent Wetherby debut, shaping with promise before fading into fourth of six
runners.spotlight: 33-1 for recent Wetherby debut (5.5f, good), shaping with promise before fading into fourth of six; probably needs to take a big step forward here.

runners.breeder: S A R L Ecurie Haras De Beauvoir
runners.comment: 80,000euros breeze-up 2yo; dam Group-placed 7f 2yo winner; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: 80,000euros breeze-up 2yo; fifth foal; half-sister to three French winners; dam Group-placed 7f 2yo winner (RPR 102), out of sister to dam of multiple 1m2f Group 1 winner Alexander Goldrun; with a top stable; shortlisted.

runners.comment: 550,000gns yearling; out of half-sister to a 6f 2yo Group 2 winner; must be considered
runners.spotlight: 550,000gns yearling; seventh foal; half-brother to winners Strait Of Hormuz (7f-1m3f; RPR 101), Siamsa (Listed-placed 7f 2yo; 92) and Optik (9.4f-1m4f AW; 65); dam placed 7f (55), half-sister to 6f 2yo Group 2 winner Mehmas; with that price-tag, he's of strong interest on debut.

runners.comment: 80,000gns yearling; half-sister to three Listed-placed winners; market may point the way
runners.spotlight: 80,000gns yearling; third foal; dam unplaced 6f-1m (RPR 62), half-sister to Listed-placed winners Chef (7f/1m), Self Centred (7f) and Muchly (1m/8.5f), out of Listed-placed 6f 2yo winner; the only filly in the line-up but good market support will put her in the picture.

racecards.betting_forecast: 15/8 Big Fun, 2/1 Vincenzo Peruggia, 4/1 Masai Angel, 9/2 Gesayed, 20/1 Daizen

racecards.race_name: New Hall Hospital Handicap

runners.breeder: Normandie Stud Ltd & Star Pointe Ltd
runners.comment: Clear best form when last to first at Chepstow (1m4f, soft) eight days ago; up 8lb
runners.spotlight: AW winner in February who took another step forward when coming from last to first in ten-runner race at Chepstow (1m4f, soft) eight days ago, winning by just over 4l; Jack Callan was placed on him in his previous two starts (one here) and returns today, to help combat his 8lb rise.

runners.breeder: Dullingham Park Stud & Mrs S Goddard
runners.owner: Mrs S Goddard And Partner I
runners.comment: Four AW runs at 1m3f/1m4f last term for Harry Eustace (same owners); seems to need better
runners.spotlight: All four runs at 1m3f/1m4f on AW last July-September, showing significant ability but that was good enough for only fourth of eight on handicap debut last time; has left Harry Eustace (same owners); apparently needs improvement but this is seemingly not a strong field.

runners.comment: Won in first-time blinkers last term but two backward steps in them since; stamina doubts
runners.spotlight: Wore blinkers last August/September on last three starts, winning here (1m2f, good to firm) on first occasion but two backward steps since and the headgear is now dispensed with; his three attempts at 1m4f/1m5f (latest on penultimate start) suggested stamina frailties.

runners.owner: P Afia, E Hobson, A Pegley, C&r Russell
runners.comment: 2nd of four at Windsor (11.4f, good to firm) penultimate start but probably needs better
runners.spotlight: Won handicap debut at Southwell (1m3f, AW) in October; clearly best result since when bustling up an odds-on 3yo in four-runner race at Windsor (11.4f, good to firm) on penultimate start but probably needs better than that.

runners.comment: Some AW efforts in the winter were respectable; tailed off back on turf after a slow start
runners.spotlight: His last win was off 9lb higher over 1m4f at Brighton in September 2023; some efforts on AW during the winter were respectable but his return to Brighton last month saw him tailed off after a slow start; none too solid.

quotes.race: Follow At The Races On Twitter Handicap
quotes.quote: We've thought a lot of Eton Blue for a long time and thought there was more to come but he was very immature. He looked fantastic in the paddock and hopefully the handicapper won't be too hard on him and we can have a lot of fun with him. Most of our horses come on as we don't overdo them at home - George Baker, trainer.

runners.comment: 0-15 on turf but finished on the winner's heels in 1m6f turf handicaps on last two outings
runners.spotlight: Dual AW winner who's 0-15 on turf but finished on the winner's heels in 1m6f turf handicaps (good to firm/good) on last two outings, the latest when front-running at Bath nine days ago; player in what looks a weak race.

runners.comment: Disappointing; left Roger Varian (same owners) since latest run; 25lb below his peak mark
runners.spotlight: String of mostly short-priced defeats, blowing out as often as not, since winning a novice at 1-7 as a 3yo; often hooded; left Roger Varian (same owners) since latest run, in March; 25lb below his peak mark.

racecards.betting_forecast: 13/8 Marioento, 7/2 Fair Dinkum, 13/2 Shady Bay, 7/1 Moon Angel, 8/1 Forest Hills,  Spectacular Style, 12/1 Eton Blue

racecards.race_name: Mercedes-Benz Of Salisbury Handicap

runners.comment: Three-time Kempton winner and yet was quiet there last month after a break
runners.spotlight: Won two novices and a handicap last year, all at Kempton over 7f; ran moderately there last month on his return from a break and he's not yet shone on the grass; others preferred.

runners.comment: Five-time turf winner who looked unlucky not to win his first AW race last time
runners.spotlight: Unraced here but a five-time turf winner over 7f at four different tracks; might well have won over 1m at Kempton (AW) last month had that race panned out more favourably; 7lb higher this time back on the grass but he can cope with this mark.

quotes.quote: We were delighted when it kept raining as Hodler is a different horse on this sort of ground, he quickens on it and picks up well. He could go to Epsom on Oaks or Derby day, there are races over seven furlongs and a mile and half a furlong. I just hope it keeps raining! - Jim Boyle, trainer.
Hodler is a nice horse and I've only sat on him three times and on all occasions he has won. He just got the ground he loves - Ryan Sexton, jockey.

runners.comment: Came from further back than the two who beat him at York last month
runners.spotlight: 7f maiden winner in 2023; it wasn't his first good run a handicap when coming from further back than the two who beat him at York last month (7f, good); that was a fine run after 261 days away.

quotes.race: Juddmonte EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (For Horses In Bands B, C And D) (EBF Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Crimson Spirit was always in a nice rhythm. He wasn't trying to run to freely early on. He got a nice flow through, found a little gap and picked up nicely. The ground was much nicer than at Nottingham. I was pleased with the way he took me down that hill. We should have some fun with him next year as well - Richard Kingscote, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He ran really well on his reappearance at York. He's a lovely, big, scopey gelding with lots to look forward to as the season progresses. He handles any track, he's versatile and he's a fun horse who should be winning more races. We're looking at Salisbury for him on Sunday. 11-06-25

runners.comment: Goes beyond 6f for the first time but she's struggled badly on her last three runs
runners.spotlight: Unraced at two and last year she won a 6f maiden and 5f handicap; that campaign didn't end well, though, and it wasn't the best of reappearances when trailing home last at Windsor (6f); that was worrying and now goes beyond 6f for the first time.

runners.comment: Might be vulnerable to younger limbs but should give his running after pleasing return
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner who goes particularly well at Brighton where he was only 2l away last month (7f, good to soft) on his return from a lengthy break; might be vulnerable to younger limbs but should give his running.

quotes.race: Marathonbet Festival Of Racing 7th-9th August Handicap
quotes.quote: Little Boy Blue took a fair hold on me early, and while I expected him to go well, I did not expect him to go that easily - Ryan While, jockey
Little Boy Blue is a fast little horse with the a sprinter's back end on him. He can only keep improving - Luke Morris, jockey.

runners.owner: SBK Racing & B & J Parr Racing Ltd
runners.comment: Consistent 6yo who fended off his rivals from the front over slightly further at Beverley
runners.spotlight: Consistent 6yo who fended off his rivals from the front over slightly further at Beverley 18 days ago (good); highly likely that he'll be involved again off 4lb higher.

quotes.quote: I probably didn't get to stack them up as much as I'd have liked but Bell Shot likes it here and he was tough - Rossa Ryan, jockey.

runners.comment: A 6yo who has only raced 11 times; ran some good races last year on turf/AW
runners.spotlight: A 6yo who has only raced 11 times; ran some good races last year on turf/AW and at Kempton last month he was held up in a race that favoured those ridden handier; not ruled out.

runners.comment: No match for the winner last time but ran well; Jack Callan claiming his 7lb is a positive
runners.spotlight: An 8yo mare who is 5lb above her last winning mark and couldn't cope with the comfortable winner last time at Chepstow (7f), where she has a solid record; Jack Callan claiming his 7lb can only enhance her prospects.

quotes.quote: RedRedRobin went up a lot in the handicap last year but she's been coming down lately, although she's not been running that well. She normally runs well here and it certainly helps when they can handle the track - Malcolm Saunders, trainer.

runners.comment: Promise over 6f/7f; can race freely and failed to see out the 1m on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Can race freely and didn't get home over 1m on handicap debut at Newmarket in November when last seen; there was sufficient promise in his qualifying runs (6f/7f) to believe he can win races off this mark.

runners.comment: Interesting on last year's high points but ran a quiet first race for this yard last month
runners.spotlight: Dual 6f winner and went close here over 6f and 7f last year when higher in the weights; however, he ran a quiet first race for this yard at Windsor last month.

racecards.betting_forecast: 4/1 Crimson Spirit, 5/1 Bell Shot, 11/2 Noel Fox, 6/1 Hodler, 13/2 Extrication, 8/1 Redredrobin,  Makes Sense, 10/1 Little Boy Blue, 14/1 Newsreader, 20/1 Snuggle

racecards.race_name: Darley EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: A beaten favourite in both her races but likely to improve for this longer trip
runners.spotlight: 500,000gns sister to Group 3 winner Noble Dynasty; a beaten favourite in both her races, though there were signs that she may have been feeling the firm ground when going down narrowly at Bath (1m); can improve for this longer trip.

runners.comment: Dubawi filly who cost 725,000gns as a yearling; one of two newcomers for her top yard
runners.spotlight: Dubawi filly who cost 725,000gns as a yearling; half-sister to winners Liwa Oasis (French 7f; RPR 90) and Lost Secret (Japanese 1m); dam unraced sister to winners Japan (1m2f/1m4f Group 1), Mogul (1m4f Group 1), Secret Gesture (1m2f Group 2) and Sir Isaac Newton (1m2f Group 3); boasts a very likeable pedigree and market should be instructive with her one of two newcomers from her yard.

runners.comment: Only narrowly denied by an unexposed winner at Lingfield; more on her plate here
runners.spotlight: Finished behind Bintalina when both were making their debuts at Haydock but was better at Lingfield (1m1f, good to firm) when only just denied by an unexposed winner; may have more on her plate here.

stable_tour.quote: She ran a really nice race last time at Lingfield. She showed a bit of greenness, so she'll run at Salisbury on Sunday or at Chelmsford, but she's a scopey, athletic filly and she'll stay further. If she stays well she could turn into something quite nice. She qualifies for the Great British Bonus, so we'll probably target that angle whereby she can win her maiden and collect one of those. 11-06-25

runners.comment: Her Wetherby second can be upgraded and the winner has since won a Listed race
runners.spotlight: Held up off a steady pace at Wetherby (1m2f, good to firm) and yet she finished only a half-length off the front-running winner who has since followed up in a Listed race; a scopey filly with more to offer.

runners.comment: Sea The Stars filly and the first foal out of a French 1m 2yo winner (RPR 97)
runners.spotlight: Sea The Stars filly and the first foal out of a French 1m 2yo winner (RPR 97), sister to winners Monumental (Group-placed 7f 2yo) and El Zoud (1m), and half-sister to winners Tantheem (5f/6f Group 3) and Murafrif (12.5f); trainer also runs Mission Possible.

racecards.betting_forecast: 2/1 Quamby, 11/4 Wujjood, 4/1 Bintalina,  Mission Possible, 7/1 Nanino Niyati

racecards.race_name: Happy 80th Birthday Richard Hannon Snr British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)

runners.comment: Close up in Lily Agnes at Chester; favourite, comfortably made all at Chepstow (6f, good)
runners.spotlight: Close up in the Lily Agnes at Chester (5f, good) on second start and comfortably made all when 11-8 favourite in a Chepstow maiden (6f, good) on latest; has a 7lb penalty against unexposed rivals but he's the pick on form and heading the right way.

quotes.race: Pricing By Real Bookmakers At DragonBet Maiden Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: This race looked the easiest possibility, and I was told that Italica couldn't beat a couple of them, but we've got experience, and that matters so much at this time of year - Tom Dascombe, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.comment: 60,000gns breeze-up 2yo by Ardad; fifth foal; brother to 6f 2yo winner Najat (RPR 83)
runners.spotlight: 50,000gns yearling, 60,000gns breeze-up 2yo by Ardad; fifth foal; brother to 6f 2yo winner Najat (RPR 83); dam 1m4f AW winner (97) out of 7.5f/1m winner; late foal but from a leading yard and needs a market check.

runners.owner: Berkshire Parts & Panels Ltd No1 Fanclub
runners.comment: 65,000gns yearling; eighth foal; half-brother to five winners; yard's 2yos are going well
runners.spotlight: 25,000gns foal, 65,000gns yearling; eighth foal; Supremacy half-brother to five winners, including Pentle Bay (Listed-placed 6f 2yo; RPR 87) and Liv My Life (5f-7f including 2yo; 77); dam French 1m4f winner; powerful yard has good strike-rate at this early stage of 2yo campaign.

runners.comment: 11-1 from 22-1 at Windsor (6f, good to firm) 13 days ago, green and soon mid-division
runners.spotlight: 100,000gns yearling; 11-1 from 22-1 for novice at Windsor (6f, good to firm) 13 days ago, running green, soon mid-division and staying there; that's fair form, though, and he should have benefited from the experience.

runners.comment: 33-1, very slowly away and always behind at Ascot (5f, good to firm) in April; gelded
runners.spotlight: 33-1, very slowly away and always behind in a conditions event at Ascot (5f, good to firm) in April; gelded two days later.

runners.comment: 22-1, bumped and hard to settle at Haydock (6f, good to firm) last month, always behind
runners.spotlight: 140,000gns yearling; 22-1, bumped at the start and proved hard to settle in novice at Haydock (6f, good to firm) last month, always behind.

runners.comment: Fourth in a small field at Newmarket (5f) and ninth in a big field at Newbury (6f)
runners.spotlight: Fourth in a small field at Newmarket (5f, good to firm) and ninth in a big field at Newbury (6f, good); has ability but others appeal more.

runners.comment: Always mid-division at Haydock (6f); open to plenty of improvement, which is needed
runners.spotlight: £68,000 yearling; 18-1 for novice at Haydock (6f, good to firm) 24 days ago, always mid-division at best but travelling okay before he ran out of steam; open to plenty of improvement, which is needed.

runners.comment: Speedy family; weak 14-1, always-prominent 2nd at Leicester (7f, good to firm) 12 days ago
runners.spotlight: 16,000gns foal from a speedy family; weak 14-1 but always prominent when second of ten in maiden at Leicester (7f, good to firm) 12 days ago; stuck to his task well, despite looking green, but worth a go at 6f; big shout.

runners.comment: 15,000gns yearling by Saxon Warrior; trainer has had 2yo winners on debut this term
runners.spotlight: 15,000gns yearling by Saxon Warrior; fourth foal; brother to Italian 6f winner Pure Circle, half-brother to Spanish 7.5f-8.5f winner Coolmeen Vega; dam unraced half-sister to winners Major's Cast (7f Listed) and Jessica's Dream (5f Group 3; dam of 1m Group 1 winner Havana Gold); trainer has had 2yo winners on debut this term.

runners.comment: 105,000gns yearling by Starman; from powerful yard whose 2yos are making a splash
runners.spotlight: 33,000euros foal, 105,000gns yearling; sixth foal; Starman half-sister to winners Must Be Late (Italian 1m 2yo; Italian Oaks runner-up; RPR 100) and Queen Of Ours (5.7f 2yo; 82); dam maiden (47) half-sister to 6f 2yo Group 2 winner Always Hopeful; from powerful yard whose 2yos are making a splash and won two of the last three renewals of this race.

racecards.betting_forecast: 3/1 Italica, 9/2 Penhallam, 5/1 Ajuda Road, 6/1 Orion's Belt, 7/1 Berkshire Boom, 8/1 Golden Brown, 10/1 Dark Mandate, 12/1 French Affair, 16/1 Spirit Of Saxony, 33/1 Dublin Bay, 40/1 First Time

racecards.race_name: H S Lester Memorial Challenge Cup "Confined" Handicap (Have Not Won Since 2024 Flat Turf Season)

runners.comment: Has the form to feature provided he's not caught out of his ground (usually held up)
runners.spotlight: Beaten 5l from an unpromising position over 1m2f at Lingfield (Class 3; AW) two months ago and that was after a break of 70 days; has only won on artificial surfaces but is a four-time runner-up on turf and can go well provided he's not caught out of his ground (usually held up).

runners.comment: 7f winner for previous yard but hasn't got anything going for her current one
runners.spotlight: Won a 7f Ayr handicap on final run for previous yard; didn't get anything going over hurdles (hooded) and beat only one home back on the Flat at Windsor (1m2f; just tongue tied); reservations at the minute.

runners.comment: Inconsistent nine-race maiden but he's still difficult to leave out of calculations
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent nine-race maiden; suffering from an irregular heartbeat when completely tailed off here two runs back but respectable on either side of that, especially when 2l away at Redcar in April (1m2f, good); difficult to leave out of calculations.

runners.comment: He's on a dangerous mark and isn't without hope of an easy lead
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner at up to 1m4f; not exactly in flying form right now but he's on a dangerous mark and isn't without hope of an easy lead.

quotes.race: Steve Watts 20yrs At Lingfield Park Handicap
quotes.quote: Sugarloaf Lenny got the mile and a half well today, which opens up a few more avenues. He's got an upward profile and the handicapper can't be too harsh, because he's only just winning - William Knight, trainer.

runners.comment: Three turf wins over 1m; fair AW effort latest and this longer trip is worth exploring
runners.spotlight: Record of 3-12, with all his wins coming in 1m turf handicaps; ran well to be beaten 4l from off the pace at Kempton a month ago and this far is worth exploring.

quotes.quote: Sunny Corner went really wide on the bend but showed a bit of ability at Windsor. He just needs to settle down and learn to chill out a bit and I think he'd be quite a nice horse. He wouldn't want it too firm, though - Stuart Kittow, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.comment: Cut out quickly when odds-on last time when close over C&D the run before
runners.spotlight: Went close in a small field over C&D (good to firm) before fluffing her lines with odds-on at Lingfield (good), where she cut out quickly when it mattered; has a big run in her if back on song; usually held up.

runners.comment: Recent efforts have been thoroughly underwhelming and so too his previous attempts at 1m2f
runners.spotlight: 4lb lower than for the last of his five wins, gained at Bath in September (1m, good); recent efforts have been thoroughly underwhelming and so too his previous attempts at 1m2f.

runners.comment: The absence is a worry but having cheekpieces back on is probably a good thing

runners.comment: Nearly defied a mammoth absence at Newbury; every chance if as good again
runners.spotlight: The winner of two 1m handicaps off a similar mark; returning from a mammoth absence when nearly adding another at Newbury a month ago (1m, good); every chance if he can avoid the feared 'bounce' factor.

stable_tour.quote: He never ran as a two-year-old but won over 1m2f at Goodwood last year off a mark of 70. He starts this year off 75 and I feel he has improved at home so I would expect him to be competitive. It will be interesting to see how much he has come on when he gets to the course, but I'm happy with him. 05-05-21

runners.comment: Never threatened to justify favouritism back at Lingfield in April but ran okay
runners.spotlight: Only 2lb higher than for 1m AW win last summer since when he's been lightly raced; never threatened to justify favouritism back at Lingfield in April but ran okay and he's not had many chances on turf.

runners.comment: Should be on a good mark but he was tailed off at 40-1 here only 22 days ago
runners.spotlight: Four-time Flat winner who should be on a good mark but he was tailed off at 40-1 here only 22 days ago.

runners.comment: A long time between drinks but he snapped his losing run with a strong finish at Brighton
runners.spotlight: A long time between drinks but he snapped his losing run with a strong finish at Brighton two weeks ago (1m, good); back up 3lb but he's returned from a break in good order.

runners.comment: Has found his level since returning from a break and looks sure to be involved once more
runners.spotlight: Back-to-back wins at Windsor (1m, good to firm) and Brighton (7f, good) before coming up shy on good to soft back at Brighton 19 days ago; off only 2lb higher he firmly enters the reckoning in today's company.

runners.comment: Three-time runner-up but off since Feb and there's probably little improvement to come
runners.spotlight: Runner-up here on debut and twice second on the AW through the winter, including a handicap off 2lb lower; however, he's a 12-race maiden who has been off since February and there's probably little improvement to come.

runners.breeder: Fiona Marner B'Stock & Mount Coote Est
runners.comment: Handicap debut; given his absence, some market support would be welcomed
runners.spotlight: Ran no race when favourite for an AW maiden (7f) when last seen in October; his previous second at Windsor offers hope with a view to being competitive off this sort of mark; given his absence, some market support would be welcomed.

runners.owner: Tim Cottier, Clark, Spence And Fellowes
runners.comment: Improved third at Kempton and the front two have gone on to better things
runners.spotlight: 0-6 but just about his best form yet when third at Kempton a month ago (7f AW; second run in cheekpieces) and the front two have gone on to better things; enters the reckoning.

runners.comment: 0-7 but was at least backed when well held at Ripon and he's returning to 7f here
runners.spotlight: 0-6 for his previous yard, though didn't run badly on occasions over 7f; never got involved on stable debut over 6f at Ripon but was well backed and he's back up in trip with cheekpieces returning.

runners.comment: Below par last time and returning to positive tactics would no doubt aid her cause
runners.spotlight: Another maiden who has hinted at winning potential but now has to rebound from a lesser run on the AW, and she has gone well at Wolverhampton in the past; returning to positive tactics would no doubt aid her cause.

runners.comment: Beaten at least 8l in his first three races (7f), the latest after wind surgery
runners.spotlight: Beaten at least 8l in his first three races (7f), the latest after wind surgery; couldn't be confident about him ahead of this handicap debut.

runners.comment: Handicap newcomer whose standout run was the second over 6f at Lingfield (AW) in January
runners.spotlight: Handicap newcomer whose standout run was the second over 6f at Lingfield (AW) in January; has enough to prove on balance on this first run since early February.

runners.comment: Eight-race maiden whose best form has been in cheekpieces; below par latest in blinkers
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden whose best form has been in cheekpieces and the return of blinkers backfired last time at Wolverhampton (7f); with those aids retained, others look safer propositions.

runners.owner: P And Mrs L Rowe And John Turner
runners.comment: Underwhelming for George Boughey and yet to raise his profile for current yard
runners.spotlight: Underwhelming for George Boughey and yet to raise his profile for current yard; cheekpieces sported the last twice are left off; unconvincing.

runners.comment: 1-15 and a prominent racer; ran an encouraging first race for this yard at Nottingham
runners.spotlight: Made all in a 7f AW handicap in January, her sole win in 15 starts; joined this yard for 7,000gns and made a positive start when beaten under 3l at Nottingham (1m, good; raced prominently); no headgear this time but that's no big deal.

runners.comment: Cheaply bought Court Cave mare, dam a 2m6f-3m1f chase winner, tongue-tied, watch
runners.spotlight: Cheaply bought Court Cave mare is a fourth foal; half-sister to 2m3f hurdle winner Tommys Charm; dam point/2m6f-3m1f chase winner, closely related to 2m Flat/useful 2m-2m4f hurdle/chase winner Truckers Delight; tongue tied; watch on debut.

runners.comment: Jukebox Jury mare, dam a bumper winner, of obvious interest on debut for top yard
runners.spotlight: Jukebox Jury mare is a second foal; half-sister to 1m7f Flat (RPR 67)/bumper and 2m-2m3f hurdle winner Williamstowndancer; dam bumper winner/placed 2m4f hurdle, sister to hurdle winners Touch Back (useful 2m2f-3m) and Sometime Soon (2m); of obvious interest on debut for top yard.

runners.comment: Placed in two of five bumpers, Down Royal second has worked out, new yard, has a squeak
runners.spotlight: Placed in two of five bumper starts on yielding-soft for Seamus Fahey; has joined Gavin Cromwell after two moderate maiden hurdle runs; form of her Down Royal second in March 2024 has worked out well, would have a squeak if repeating that.

runners.comment: Improved effort on stable debut but still beaten 13l, soft would be a worry, more needed
runners.spotlight: Didn't show much in three starts for Lorna Fowler; better effort on debut for this yard in a Kilbeggan (2m, good) bumper but still beaten 13l; declared to run in 1.40 here on Saturday (second reserve); soft ground would be a worry; more needed.

runners.comment: Yeats mare, dam won a 2m hurdle, worth a market check on debut
runners.spotlight: Yeats mare is a first foal; dam 2m hurdle winner, out of unraced half-sister to French 2m4f Grade 3 hurdle winner Malone; worth a market check on debut.

runners.comment: Won a Dromahane point by 9l, interesting Rules debutante, monitor the market
runners.spotlight: Walk In The Park mare; dam a half-sister to the useful stayer Golan Fortune; won a Dromahane point-to-point (3m, gd-yld) by 9l in November for Mary Ellen Doyle and has since joined John McConnell; interesting Rules debutante worth a market check.

runners.comment: Point winner, has run well here over timber, best form on good ground, needs rain to miss
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner has shown ability in a bumper and two maiden hurdles, including one here, on good ground; the forecast rain has to rate a big concern (pulled up and beaten 23l two starts on yielding); needs the rain to miss.

runners.comment: Berkshire filly, dam a half-sister to classy Paisley Park, may need further, check market
runners.spotlight: Home-bred Berkshire filly is a seventh foal; half-sister to point winner Just Hannah; dam unraced half-sister to top-class 2m3f-3m hurdle winner Paisley Park; from a good family but may need further than this in time; still worth checking in the market.

runners.comment: Maxios filly, half-sister to two winners, yard 0-23 in bumpers last five seasons, watch
runners.spotlight: Maxios filly is a ninth foal; half-sister to winners Javert (useful 2m-2m5f chase) and Murrayana (2m4f/2m5f hurdle); dam third in French 1m7f hurdle, half-sister to smart 2m-3m2f jump winner Le Duc; yard 0-23 in bumpers last five seasons; watch.

runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage Des Loges & M Francis Dunn
runners.comment: Masked Marvel filly, well beaten in maiden hurdle at Ballinrobe, may need more time
runners.spotlight: Masked Marvel filly was sent off at 12-1 on debut in a mares' maiden hurdle at Ballinrobe (16.5f, good) last month and was beaten 28l into fifth (flashed tail); could improve for softer ground but she may need more time.

runners.comment: Sholokhov filly, dam a half-sister to bumper winner but probably best watched on debut
runners.spotlight: Cheaply bought Sholokhov filly is a third foal; dam placed 2m-2m6f hurdles, half-sister to useful winners Montbazon (bumper/2m hurdle) and Valleres (2m3f-3m hurdle/chase), out of 2m winner; yard 0-9 in bumpers last five seasons; probably best watched on debut.

runners.spotlight: Five-race maiden who has shown very little and was pulled up on last month's handicap debut.

runners.comment: Has won 3 over timber but tailed off in his last couple of starts and needs quicker ground
runners.spotlight: Has won three over timber but tailed off in his last couple of starts and needs quicker ground than what's likely.

runners.comment: Shown very little at huge odds so far, including when switched to a handicap latest
runners.spotlight: Shown very little at huge odds so far, including when switched to a handicap last time; enough to prove.

runners.comment: Has become well treated on old form but with good reason and he was tailed off last week
runners.spotlight: Has become well treated on old form but with good reason and he was tailed off at Clonmel last week.

quotes.quote: Ricky Langford wants good ground. He has a similar mark over fences and he could go for a handicap chase before the summer is out - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

runners.comment: Tailed off latest but had previously shown a bit of promise; slow ground an unknown
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in a maiden hurdle at Clonmel last week but had previously shown a bit of promise at that venue; slower ground an unknown.

runners.spotlight: Winner at Clonmel in February and showed that was no fluke when only beaten roughly 2l in follow up bid at Down Royal; well held at Kilbeggan last time but previous runs give him a squeak.

quotes.quote: Ar Nos Na Gaoithe is just a small, summery mare and one that will give her owners tremendous fun. I told them we will keep trying and we will have our day - Philip Rothwell, trainer

runners.comment: Only very minor promise in trio of maiden hurdle starts; worth a market check on h'cap bow
runners.spotlight: Only very minor promise in trio of maiden hurdle starts; worth a market check on handicap debut but percentage call is to look elsewhere.

runners.comment: Tailed off in two runs since belated return and looks very risky
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden; showed promise in bumpers in 2022; tailed off in two runs since belated return and looks very risky.

runners.comment: 0-8; only distant 5th here latest; better runs on quicker ground than what's likely
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden who was only a distant fifth here last time; better runs have come on quicker ground than what's likely.

runners.comment: Some promising efforts last summer but has lost her way more recently; pulled up latest
runners.spotlight: Some promising efforts last summer but has lost her way more recently and was pulled up at Kilbeggan a fortnight ago; hard to fancy.

runners.comment: Encouraging 3rd over 2m6f here but pulled up when failing to build on that at Wexford
runners.spotlight: Encouraging course third over 2m6f on penultimate run but was pulled up a long way out at Wexford last time; now tried with tongue-tie.

runners.spotlight: Got off the mark at the seventh attempt over hurdles in fine style off 105 at Sligo (3m2f, good) five days ago, relishing the step up in distance; 5lb claimer eases welter burden but the marked drop in trip has to be a worry.

prev_owners.owner: Poetry In Motion Syndicate/Gavin Cromwell Racing Limited

runners.comment: Two-time Flat winner in Denmark, promise in maiden hurdles, others look better treated
runners.spotlight: Two-time Flat winner in Denmark is 0-3 over timber and rated 110; has shown promise in last two maiden hurdles at around 2m and now steps up in trip; others look better treated by the race conditions.

runners.comment: Lightly raced 7yo, form of Sedgefield maiden win has been franked, should go well
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner on yielding; won a 2m4f Sedgefield maiden hurdle (good) in April on return from 244 days off and the second, third and fourth from that race have all won since; yard had a welcome winner on Thursday at Leopardstown; lightly raced sort should be fine over this shorter trip.

runners.comment: Won on hurdling debut at Kilbeggan (2m, good), form boosted by second, rain a worry
runners.spotlight: Didn't show much in bumpers on easy ground but belied odds of 14-1 to win a 2m Kilbeggan maiden (good) last month on hurdling debut; the runner up has boosted the form; interesting, though the forecast rain may not be ideal.

runners.comment: Off the mark on hurdles bow at Tipperary, form has taken knocks, needs the rain to miss
runners.spotlight: Two runs in bumpers on yielding-soft were modest but a first-time hood (retained) and switch to hurdles after a 122-day break saw him win a Tipperary maiden last month (2m1f, gd-yld); that form has taken a couple of knocks and the forecast rain is not in his favour.

quotes.quote: Ballyearl was a bit keen on his first two runs but after a break and with the hood and nice ground, he switched off and jumped well. He showed a good attitude up the straight and found plenty - Darragh O'Keeffe, jockey.

runners.comment: 0-5 over timber, best run yet on latest at Ballinrobe, untried on soft, others appeal more
runners.spotlight: 0-5 over timber; best effort to date on latest when a 5.5l fourth of 15 off 99 in a handicap hurdle at Ballinrobe (16.5f, good); untried on soft ground and others make more appeal.

runners.owner: Robin McNeilly & Mrs Dorothy McNeilly & Paul McNeilly
runners.comment: Veteran has run well here in bumpers, strip fitter for latest, hood returns, more needed
runners.spotlight: Veteran went close in a 2m3f bumper (good) here last July in this headgear combination; well beaten minus the hood on return from 312 days off in a 2m3f maiden hurdle here (good); will strip fitter now and the hood returns but lots more needed.

prev_owners.owner: Tobias Jones, James Finch & Samuel Sutton

runners.comment: French Flat winner, yet to show anything for current yard, hard to make a case for
runners.spotlight: Won twice on the Flat in France; yet to show anything in three runs for this yard; beaten 62l sole completed start over timber and 23l on latest on the Flat at Cork; hard to make a case for.

racecards.betting_forecast: 3/1 Sage Conseil, 7/2 Warriors Wood, 100/30 Ballyearl, 4/1 Boston Rajj, 9/1 Dunkerque, 10/1 Brave Soldier, 16/1 Cap Bernat, 40/1 Bruant

racecards.race_name: Download The Tote App Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Bumper winner here; narrowly denied 3rd hurdle win 2 runs ago; ignore latest Flat run
runners.spotlight: Won a bumper at this venue and only narrowly denied a third success over timber at Ballinrobe two runs ago; subsequent Flat run worth ignoring and he's feasibly treated; versatile with regards to conditions.

quotes.quote: Coming here today it looked a hot beginners', but then the favourite came out. I still thought it would be tough task against a 137-rated chaser in Mighty Tom, but Extrapolation loves good ground like that and it's terrific to get the win - Richard O'Brien, trainer.
Extrapolation grasped a nice opportunity here and he did it well. He moved up into it well and he ran on nicely - Danny Mullins, rider

I thought Extrapolation had run two very good races on testing ground and this was lesser opposition. He did it well and could go for a Flat race, maybe the amateurs' race in Galway. He won't go on very deep winter ground - Richard O'Brien, trainer.

runners.comment: Won Gowran maiden hurdle 2 narrow defeats and good Fairyhouse 3rd; may have needed return
runners.spotlight: Off the mark in a maiden hurdle at Gowran in October prior to two narrow defeats and a respectable third of 24 at Fairyhouse; well held at Cork on April's return to action but may have needed that first run in five months.

quotes.quote: Tonaghneave Well had the experience. I dropped my stick going to the last and he was having a good look so thankfully I held on. He was being a little bit lairy but experience probably won it for him - Keith Donoghue, rider.

runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage Des Loges
runners.comment: Wide margin Limerick winner; back to form at Tramore latest; 5lb rise fair and ground fine
runners.spotlight: Wide margin maiden hurdle winner at Limerick in January and bounced back from disappointing run at Ayr when staying on well to land a Tramore handicap hurdle last month, getting the better of Hasten Slowly; 5lb rise is fair and acts on slower ground.

stable_tour.quote: He wasn't a bumper horse so he's much better than the bare form of his run at Roscommon. Expect him to leave that form well behind when he goes over hurdles. 28-10-24

runners.comment: Won claimer before 2nd here; unlucky not to win over fences since; may need this return
runners.spotlight: Won a claimer before finishing runner-up to Mordor here last August; unlucky not to gain a chase win at Cork when falling late on his penultimate run; tailed off at Down Royal when last seen in November and likely to need this return run (off 225 days).

quotes.quote: Dollar Value is in a great vein of form at the minute. We're going to be well up in the weights now so we're going to go for the Grade 2 Champion Chase at Gowran. He's match fit and some horses will be coming back from a break so why not have a go. He does things on his own terms and he's a great horse to train - Tom McCourt, trainer.

Dollar Value is a right horse on his day. He behaved himself at the start today. I'm just trying to keep him to smaller fields at the minute. You have less hassle at the start. I'd love to go for a good race with him, we are going to have to now - Tom McCourt, trainer.

I was very cagey about running Dollar Value again after he ran last night but Colin Keane came back in last night and the first thing he said before he hopped off him was that if he was all right in the morning, run him again. That swung it for me - Tom McCourt, trainer.

Dollar Value is a very good horse and I think he is definitely able to win a proper race. He's not totally straightforward but he has serious ability. He won his novice chase here from right off the pace. He has a bit of class - Tom McCourt, trainer.
Dollar Value can get a bit free so Conor dropped him out, hunted around and crept closer. He's a lovely horse - Tom McCourt, trainer

Dollar Value has won over 2m4f over hurdles and is a nice big galloping horse. He'll mix it between hurdles and the Flat for now and he will jump a fence too, he has schooled over them - Tom McCourt, trainer

runners.comment: Hat-trick here last summer; Carlisle winner in Feb; pulled up latest but may bounce back
runners.spotlight: Rattled off a hat-trick at this venue last year and added a Carlisle success in February; pulled up at Punchestown last month but return to this venue may spark a revival.

prev_owners.owner: Mrs M Cahill & Mrs Caroline Hendron & Ciaran Kennelly

runners.comment: Caught late by Bowensonfire at Tramore but rain is a concern with her best form on good
runners.spotlight: Only caught late by Bowensonfire at Tramore 16 days ago and still lightly raced over hurdles; rain is a concern with all her best form on good, though.

quotes.quote: Hasten Slowly relaxed well through the race and hit the line well. Her jumping was very good and she got the trip well. Hopefully she can win another few - Ben Harvey, rider

quotes.race: Lucan Bloodstock Build For The Boys Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Hasten Slowly was one I thought would climb last year but she went backwards. I think she will improve going out in trip and she loves fast ground. Hopefully she will go on from this - Noel Meade, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Auction Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: A lot of our two-year-olds have been running well without winning. We think Hasten Slowly is quite nice and Encosta is very nice as well. Just because they've been running so green, when we run them, I said we'd better run the other one as well. Colin (Keane) said she's still very laid-back, he always thought he had the runner-up covered but then she dawdled about a little late on. She's a nice, strong filly and loves fast ground - Noel Meade, trainer

runners.comment: Badly out of form this year and pulled up a long way out at Kilbeggan latest; back in trip
runners.spotlight: Badly out of form this year and pulled up a long way out at Kilbeggan latest; back down in trip with plenty to prove.

runners.comment: Lost his way; tailed off when last seen over timber and same story in 3 chase runs since
runners.spotlight: Has lost his way of late, finishing tailed off when last seen over timber in November and it's been the same story in three subsequent chase starts.

quotes.quote: The Dasher Conway put the race to bed with his jumping, he was very good everywhere. If you jump and travel like that around here he was going to be difficult to get by - Donagh Meyler, rider

quotes.race: Follow @TipperaryRaces On Twitter Maiden Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: It's been a while since The Dasher Conway's last run and he's been improving all the time. He's a fabulous big horse. Hopefully there'll be more days with him and it's great to get this - Gillian O'Callaghan, trainer.

runners.comment: Course winner; won most recent hurdle outing but best form on quicker ground; off 233 days
runners.spotlight: Course winner who won his most recent hurdle outing at Kilbeggan and added another chase success at Sligo in October; however, best form is on quicker ground and he's been off 233 days.

quotes.quote: Ceanndana jumped well today and it went according to plan. He is a summer horse and wants nice ground - Keith Donoghue, rider

quotes.race: Ivo O'Sullivan Snr Memorial Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Ceanndana has been trying hard and he is in that 0-95 bracket. He will find it harder now that he's out of that bracket but it's great to win two races with him. He could go chasing now - Ross O'Sullivan, trainer.

runners.comment: Has got the hang of things over hurdles, winning last two and 6lb rise looks lenient
runners.spotlight: Fair performer on the Flat for Emmet Mullins and has really got the hang of things over timber for his new connections, winning back-to-back handicaps at Kilbeggan; 6lb rise for his latest success looks on the lenient side and ought to go well in his hat-trick bid.

quotes.quote: Malbay Madness is probably a hardy little horse. He was full of life going to the start and I'm sure they will have plenty of fun with him - Colin Keane, rider.

runners.comment: Won maiden hurdle at Sligo but nothing in h'cap twice since and stiff looking h'cap mark
runners.spotlight: Won maiden hurdle at Sligo but nothing in handicaps twice since and stiff looking handicap mark for now.
