racecards.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Dual-purpose, come on for stable debut at Ballinrobe, 6lb above last win, rain a negative
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose mare has won eight races across both codes; made a pleasing enough start for this yard when third of six at Ballinrobe on first run for over six months; should come on for that but she remains 6lb above her last win and she won't want it too soft.

quotes.race: Powerscreen New England Supporting Louth GAA Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: The ground was key to Dame Rapide today. She's been running well all year and she deserved that. She's a lovely honest mare and I think she's improving as she's getting older. Hopefully there is more to come from her and she'll jump a fence too in time - James Barrett, trainer.

quotes.race: Download The App At Novibet Handicap
quotes.quote: Dame Rapide was always a bit buzzy and keen but she's relaxed more at home and is finishing her races real well now. She jumps hurdles well but was in season the last day in Cork and never showed up. We'll probably mix and match it with her and hopefully we can go back and win a hurdle with her - James Barrett, trainer

quotes.race: William Hill Scratch Of The Day Handicap
quotes.quote: Dame Rapide is still improving and I don't know where she's going to stop or where she's going to go next. We said we'd come here, we thought we were out of our depth but we weren't. We'll probably have to look for something bigger and see where she lies, probably Group 3 or Listed now - Barry Fitzgerald, trainer.

runners.comment: Bellewstown maiden winner, good run at Navan in December, fit from the Flat, go well
runners.spotlight: Won a Bellewstown maiden hurdle in April 2024 (20.5f, gd-yld); best effort since a 6l second of 15 at Navan (2m4f, yld-sft) in December and that form has had a few boosts; has had a couple of sharpeners on the Flat and she could go well back over timber.

runners.comment: Roscommon maiden winner, poor efforts last twice, lacks recent run, check market
runners.spotlight: Roscommon maiden hurdle winner on second start last September (20.5f, yielding); poor efforts in a Listed race and a handicap last twice; off since November and the market should reveal expectations on return for in form yard.

runners.comment: Shaped like her turn was near here latest, go well again off 2lb higher if rain misses
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose mare; without a win since August 2023 but shaped like her turn was near here last time out when beaten just 1.75l into third on good ground; should go well again off 2lb higher, though the forecast rain is a concern.

quotes.quote: Rockview Consort  jumped well. John (McConnell) does a good job schooling his horses at home, he doesn't like to miss with these nice ones first-time out. I kept it simple, it was a nice even gallop and you can do that around here on good ground. It was a pretty good performance and she's one we'll look forward to - Ben Harvey, jockey, talking to Racing TV
Rockview Consort probably wants further but we said we would have another crack at this trip. It is great to get the win and she will go on turf as well - John McConnell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She took a while to win her maiden but did so nicely at Dundalk last time over 1m2½f. She has a 3lb higher rating on the turf and, having given her a break after that success, she'll be brought back for 1m4f handicaps on the grass. She also jumps well and is a possible for some hurdling this summer. 06-04-23

runners.comment: 1-17, no win since September 2023, 1lb below last success but needs to revive
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard; Has won one of 17 starts over hurdles; that win came in September 2023 at Clonmel (3m, sft-hvy) off 98; is 1lb lower now but hasn't looked like ending her losing run in recent starts; beaten 37l at Sligo on latest; needs a revival.

runners.comment: Has won five over hurdles, 9lb below last win but badly out of form, others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; dual-purpose mare is 5-40 over hurdles; 9lb below last win but she's been out of form in 2025 in both codes; beaten 91l on latest hurdles start and 19l on the Flat at Leopardstown latest; others appeal more.

quotes.quote: That was a good performance from Influential Lady. She's been off the track for a while and the plan today was to sneak around and try to pick up any prize-money we could - just ride her patiently. It kind of fell into her lap and she was very good. The race was run to suit her as we got racing early down the back and I just crept away the whole way. She was fit and ready, and looked great in the paddock beforehand - Kieran Callaghan, rider.

We didn't think the trip was ideal for Influential Lady today so were adamant to make it a good test. I didn't think I'd get it as easy in front and she quickened from two out and again from the last to the line. She had a nice light weight so we were going to make plenty of use of it. Her jumping was brilliant - Kieran Callaghan, jockey, talking to Racing TV

quotes.race: Holden Plant Rentals Mares Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Influential Lady was great to come out on top in a tight finish like that. She was brave and it was a very good ride by Cathal. She's been a great mare for us and seems to be improving with racing - Jimmy Barcoe, trainer.
Influential Lady came out of her last race well and she stayed well today. She's thriving on it and I think she will handle winter ground - Jim Barcoe, trainer.
Influential Lady had a good run at Listowel the other day and backed it up. She is a fine, good-looking mare and coming back to this grade helped her - Jim Barcoe, trainer

runners.comment: Flat winner, shaped like this trip would suit on penultimate, seems best on good ground
runners.spotlight: Flat winner is 0-9 over hurdles but has run well in defeat; poor effort at Sligo latest (17.5f, good) but was a 3l third of 15 at Ballinrobe (16.5f, good) on penultimate when shaping like this trip might suit; chance if repeating that but seems best on good ground.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The ground was probably tight enough for Leitzel today and she didn't travel around as well as she did the last day. She's still quite nervous and green and hopefully she's only going to go one way. It was a good performance and she could be a nice filly next year - Danny Tudhope, rider.

stable_tour.quote: She won her first two last year and then wasn't suited by the seven furlongs in the Rockfel. She'll stay a mile and a quarter and we'll start her back up in trip, possibly at York. 04-05-23

runners.owner: Living Life to The Maxios Syndicate
runners.comment: Won off 93 in February, good effort in Gr 3 handicap off 105 latest, big chance if stays
runners.spotlight: 4yo filly won first race over hurdles in a handicap at Fairyhouse in February (2m, soft) off 93; not disgraced in first run since in grade 3 mares' handicap at Cheltenham (2m1f, good) off 105; 5lb lower here and ground versatile; big chance if she stays.

racecards.betting_forecast: 7/4 Maxios Prime, 7/2 Rockview Consort, 9/2 Dame Rapide, 13/2 Theflyingbee, 7/1 Mexican Moonshine, 16/1 Leitzel, 20/1 Influential Lady, 25/1 Brianna Lily

racecards.race_name: Randox Maiden Hurdle

runners.comment: Promising 4th at Down Royal last month but hasn't built on that; bit to find
runners.spotlight: Promising fourth at Down Royal last month but didn't build on that when tailed off at Ballinrobe since over a new trip; return to this sort of distance may help but has a bit to find.

runners.comment: Progressed from debut to finish distant 4th latest but needs sizeable improvement now
runners.spotlight: Progressed from debut effort to finish a distant fourth at Kilbeggan last time; will need a sizeable chunk of improvement to figure here though.

runners.comment: Promising debut before bumper 2nd here; hasn't progressed since; jumping needs to improve
runners.spotlight: Promising debut before hitting the crossbar at this venue (beaten roughly 1l); however, mixed signals on the strength of that form and hasn't built on the run twice since, including over C&D latest; jumping needs to improve this time.

runners.comment: Promise in 2 runs a few years ago; well related and has to be of interest despite absence
runners.spotlight: Well held fourth in a bumper on debut before a C&D fifth when last seen in 2023; half-brother to Dysart Dynamo and Dysart Diamond so has to be of interest for these connections; now tried with tongue-tie returning from 728 days off.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Quesnay
runners.comment: Minor promise on the Flat but tailed off at triple figure odds in two starts over timber
runners.spotlight: Minor promise on the Flat but tailed off at triple figure odds in two starts over timber.

runners.comment: Shown more recently and only beaten 7l over C&D last month; half-brother to Slade Steel
runners.spotlight: Tailed off on debut in a bumper but has shown more in two subsequent outings and was only beaten roughly 7l over C&D last month; half-brother to Slade Steel and slower ground may help; one for the shortlist.

runners.comment: Placed here second time out before Listowel 2nd and intermediate trip may suit
runners.spotlight: Hit the frame over 2m6f here second time out and best run yet when dropped in distance, beaten roughly 2l at Listowel 13 days ago; this intermediate trip may be the way forward and should be involved.

runners.comment: 2nd to Addragoole in Feb'; good 2nd 2 runs ago; disappointed latest but can bounce back
runners.spotlight: Chased home Addragoole at Clonmel in February and bounced back from lesser run when beaten roughly 1l at Ballinrobe; disappointing when 15-8 back at that track 20 days ago (reportedly blowing hard post race) but this shorter trip may suit and will be a major player if he gets back on track.

runners.comment: Well held 80-1 shot in bumper on debut; that run wasn't devoid of promise but more needed
runners.spotlight: Well held 80-1 shot in a Punchestown bumper on debut; that run wasn't devoid of promise but needs much more here.

runners.comment: Shown nothing in 4 Flat runs; not bred for this; new yard returning from 233 days off
runners.spotlight: Shown nothing in four Flat runs and not really bred for this; new yard returning from 233 days off.

runners.comment: Promising Flat form and creditable 3rd on hurdle bow but hasn't kicked on twice since
runners.spotlight: Promising Flat form before finishing third on hurdle bow at Fairyhouse; however, hasn't kicked on twice since and he was disappointing when 6-4fav for a Killarney maiden hurdle last month; needs to bounce back.

runners.breeder: Mickley Stud, F Ellis & Mr & Mrs Dawson
runners.comment: 5-6 favourite for a Clonmel bumper last week but finished a distant 4th and looked green
runners.spotlight: 5-6 favourite for a Clonmel bumper last week but finished a distant fourth and looked green; needs to have learnt plenty.

runners.comment: Ran well for a long way on hurdle debut at Kilbeggan in April, outrunning odds of 100-1
runners.spotlight: Showed very little on the Flat but ran well for a long way on hurdles debut at Kilbeggan in April, outrunning odds of 100-1; needs to settle better this time and may encounter slower ground if the rain arrives.

runners.comment: Modest form in 2 runs so far inc' when tailed off in Punchestown maiden hurdle last week
runners.spotlight: Modest efforts in two runs so far including when tailed off in a Punchestown maiden hurdle a week ago; much more required.

runners.comment: 0-11 on the Flat and finished tailed off when 200-1 for hurdle bow at Clonmel last month
runners.spotlight: 0-11 on the Flat and finished tailed off when 200-1 for hurdle bow at Clonmel last month.

runners.comment: 2nd in a point; not beaten far in bumper but tailed off last week on hurdle debut; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; runner-up in a point; wasn't beaten far in a bumper on penultimate outing but tailed off last week on hurdle debut.

runners.comment: Some promise on the Flat but probably best watched returning from 442 days off; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; some promise on the Flat but probably best watched returning from 442 days off if he gets a run.

runners.comment: Didn't show enough when tailed off on last month's debut; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; didn't show enough when tailed off on last month's debut.

racecards.betting_forecast: 11/4 Yoradreamer, 7/2 Dysart Dasher, 5/1 Penny Express, 6/1 Young Churchill, 13/2 Parkgarve, 10/1 Dramatic License, 16/1 Doorman Moe,  Forty Kay, 20/1 Colvin,  Jessie's Dreamgirl,  Gerrys Wish, 40/1 Little Boy Sivola, 100/1 Silk Degrees, 200/1 On The Cards,  Tiffany Mae

racecards.race_name: Adare Manor Opportunity Maiden Hurdle

runners.comment: Point winner and wide margin course bumper winner; step up in trip should suit
runners.spotlight: Point winner who came on from his rules debut to win a course bumper in facile style; form done no favours since and different ground this time with rain likely but has to be high on the shortlist with the step up in trip likely to yield improvement.

runners.comment: Point winner; won in good style on rules debut and possibly didn't take to AW since
runners.spotlight: Point winner who won in better style than the winning margin suggested on rules debut at Tipperary; possibly didn't take to AW in a Lingfield bumper when turned over at 2-7 but could easily bounce back now hurdling and the new trip ought to suit.

runners.comment: Bolted up in bumper here before narrow Bellewstown defeat; didn't jump well on hurdle bow
runners.spotlight: Bolted up in a bumper here last summer before narrow defeat at Bellewstown; didn't jump well on hurdle bow subsequently though and has been off 310 days.

runners.comment: 3-time winner on the Flat but shown nothing in three hurdle outings and others preferred
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner on the Flat but shown nothing in three hurdle outings and others preferred.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies Handicap
quotes.quote: Drop The Dip is as solid as a rock - she's very strong and has been running well all season. She handles good ground well and the only question mark going to Listowel last week was whether she would handle softer ground. After she did, we figured it wouldn't be a problem today, so she's very versatile. You would think she was semi-idling, but she was tough and Gavin (Ryan) said she had to be - Thomas Gibney, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.comment: Point winner; well held 16-1 shot on rules debut though; needs more for new trip
runners.spotlight: Point winner in November; well held when 16-1 for rules debut in a Ballinrobe bumper; needs improvement for the step up in trip.

runners.comment: Placed in 5 maiden hurdle starts; respectable 3rd latest but bit more exposed than some
runners.spotlight: Has hit the frame on all five maiden hurdle outings and chased home his two main market rivals at Kilbeggan last time; can be involved again but looks a bit more exposed than some of his rivals.

runners.owner: Denis O'Mahony & Daibheid McHugh & Desmond J Kelly

prev_owners.owner: Thomas B Breen & Roderick Ryan & M D Minch

runners.comment: Some promise for Willie Mullins last year but tailed off in three runs for new connections
runners.spotlight: Some promise for Willie Mullins last year but tailed off in three runs for new connections; engaged here Saturday.

runners.comment: Improved with each run; stayed on well for 3rd latest; needs more again; different ground
runners.spotlight: Has improved with each outing and stayed on well for third in a Ballinrobe maiden hurdle last month when trying this sort of trip for the first time; further progress required to land this though and different ground likely too.

runners.comment: Shown very little under rules so far at huge prices; off 183 days; easy to look elsewhere
runners.spotlight: Shown very little under rules so far at huge prices; off 183 days and easy to look elsewhere.

runners.comment: Minor signs of ability in bumpers; 2m didn't suit latest; may do better this time
runners.spotlight: Minor signs of ability in bumpers and probably unsuited by the drop in trip at Ballinrobe last time; step up to this distance ought to help and not ruled out.

runners.comment: Similar level in each of 3 runs; work to do with Keep Kool Coko from last time out
runners.spotlight: Has run to a similar level in each of his three maiden hurdle outings; has work to do to turn Kilbeggan form around with Keep Kool Coko.

runners.comment: Marcel gelding; dam placed 7f AW (RPR 56); tough for newcomer
runners.spotlight: Marcel gelding; dam placed 7f AW (RPR 56), half-sister to 2m5f hurdle winner Mr Caplan, out of unraced half-sister to 6f 2yo winner Blue Daze; this looks tough for a newcomer.

runners.comment: Shown nothing at triple figure odds in three outings so far
runners.spotlight: Shown nothing at triple figure odds in three outings so far.

runners.comment: Promising bumper debut; back to form at Tramore last month; more needed; second-string
runners.spotlight: Promising debut in a bumper and back to form when runner-up at Tramore last month; this requires more and yard have stronger claims with Full Confession.

runners.comment: 0-11 on the Flat and unseated at the first when 66s for her hurdle debut last week
runners.spotlight: 0-11 on the Flat and unseated at the first when 66s for her hurdle debut last week.

racecards.betting_forecast: 9/4 Full Confession, 3/1 Cinammon Roll, 9/2 Keep Kool Coko, 5/1 Sugar Cookie, 11/1 Whiskey On Ice, 12/1 Mavetherave,  The Goose's Acre, 20/1 Maroto, 25/1 Jackson Lamb,  Hickeys Hill, 40/1 Tinker Hill, 100/1 Drop The Dip,  Never Present,  Imperial Miss, 200/1 Niamhie

racecards.race_name: Thomastown Race

runners.owner: Mark E Phelan & S P O'Connor
runners.comment: Solid performer in premier handicaps but no easy task conceding weight
runners.spotlight: Ran well in some hot handicaps last year, including close fourth both at Galway and in Irish Cambridgeshire; another solid run on last month's return under top-weight at the Curragh but no easy task conceding weight to some decent sorts here over a trip which is his limit.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Supporting Cancer Trials Ireland Irish Cambridgeshire (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Coeur d'Or is just a very tough, genuine and game horse. In his younger days he was a very immature horse but I gave him plenty of time and now it's paying dividends. He loves to come from off the pace and is very consistent. He will step up a couple of furlongs and come back here on Champions Weekend for the Northfields Handicap - Dermot Weld, trainer.

quotes.race: COLM QUINN BMW Mile Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Coeur D'or has been a very consistent all year. He is a very brave horse. We were a little worried about the ground, but this has been the plan and the horse delivered. He took a lot of time to come to hand but patience paid dividends - Dermot Weld, trainer.
Coeur D'Or got an easy lead, they went no pace, and it worked out well. Chris kicked off the front end and he won well, it was a super ride - Dermot Weld, trainer.
Coeur D'Or has done a few different things with him at home and we thought coming here might give him a new lease of life. He toughed it out well - Chris Hayes, rider.

prev_owners.owner: G & M Roberts, Green, Savidge & Whittal-Williams

runners.comment: Hampered when below best latest in Listed class; big player if back to his best
runners.spotlight: Gained all three wins in 2023, including handicaps over 1m and 1m2f at Leopardstown on heavy; solid comeback run over an inadequate trip but below best in Listed company recently, having been hampered early on; big player if back to his best.

quotes.quote: Cristal Clere had great runs last summer and is a really consistent horse. He took off on the soft ground the other day and again today - John Nallen, trainer.

runners.comment: C&D winner last year; below best on seasonal return but respected, easier ground to suit
runners.spotlight: Two wins last year included valuable C&D success in conditions event; some good runs in Listed company afterwards on softer ground, below best on seasonal return in Group 3 at the Curragh; has to be respected given her overall profile and easier ground in her favour.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Gowran Classic
quotes.quote: Fleur De Chine stayed every yard of that and she can probably step up to 1m4f. She has a free entry for the Irish Derby so we could enter her and see what happens - Jessica Harrington, trainer

Fleur De Chine was very good. We were disappointed at the Curragh but she just pulled up a little bit sore that day. We'll see what mark she gets and hopefully she can pick up some black type later in the year - Kate Harrington, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She ran okay at the Curragh. She always takes a run to come to herself and she'll head straight to the Victor McCalmont Stakes at Gowran Park now. She's got form around the track and we'll be hoping for a big run from her there. 23-04-25

runners.comment: Recent C&D fourth encouraging; more needed and stronger stayers in the field
runners.spotlight: Won Tipperary maiden last September and ran respectably in a French Group 3 next time; something of a return to form over C&D early this month when deprived of third late on by stablemate Viking Invasion in very valuable conditions event; more needed and stronger stayers in the field.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Auction Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Dignam is a grand, solid horse. He has a good turn of foot and has a bit of quality about him - Declan McDonogh, rider.

runners.comment: C&D maiden winner unable to cut it in strong Listed since; this looks a weaker race
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 3yo ran away with C&D maiden in April (yielding) but never counted in strong Leopardstown Listed early this month (2l off Cristal Clere); remains a potential improver and this looks a weaker race.

runners.comment: Recent C&D third a career-best; could have more to offer at this distance
runners.spotlight: Wide-margin maiden winner here last October and career-best on returning here early this month in first-time cheekpieces (now replaced by blinkers) in very valuable conditions event over this trip, staying on late to deprive Dignam of third; could have more to offer at this distance.

quotes.quote: Viking Invasion improved a lot for stepping up in trip. It was just a bit sharp for him the last day. He handles this ground and quickened up well. He's a colt with plenty of potential and hopefully can keep on improving - Dylan Browne McMonagle, rider

racecards.betting_forecast: 5/2 Fleur De Chine, 11/4 Coeur d'Or, 7/2 Cristal Clere, 13/2 Eastwatch, 7/1 Viking Invasion, 10/1 Dignam

racecards.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies Maiden

runners.comment: No real threat on both AW runs last winter for Danny Murphy; turf debut for rookie trainer
runners.spotlight: Siyouni filly cost 75,000gns as a yearling and 110,000euros as a breeze-up purchase; no real threat on both AW runs last winter for Danny Murphy, well-backed favourite on debut when tongue-tied; makes turf debut and first runner for rookie trainer.

runners.comment: Tramore bumper winner last summer; switches to Flat on return
runners.spotlight: Tramore bumper winner last summer (good), well held here in fillies Listed bumper afterwards; switches to the Flat here on return.

runners.comment: Naas fourth a big step forward; upped in trip here and has her chance
runners.spotlight: 325,000gns yearling; left debut effort behind to finish close up over 1m at Naas (good) last month; upped in trip here and has her chance.

runners.comment: Not clear run when 3/4l off Angelight at Naas; should relish longer trip and big player
runners.spotlight: Sea The Stars filly lost out narrowly over 7f at Leopardstown last October on sole start at two; favourite, denied a clear run from 1f out on seasonal return at Naas last month when 3/4l off Angelight; should appreciate this longer trip and no surprise if she turned the tables on that rival here; big player.

runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Debut promise but didn't look straightforward on latest; has the ability
runners.spotlight: Kingman filly comes from top-class Aga Khan family; promising Leopardstown debut in April when staying on late over 1m2f but didn't make the anticipated improvement following month when odds-on for similar contest, flashing tail and hanging for pressure; questions to answer after latest but has the ability to play a major role.

runners.comment: Half-sister to 1m/1m1f winner Alessia Fernanda; seemingly the Weld second-choice on debut
runners.spotlight: Saxon Warrior half-sister to 1m/1m1f winner Alessia Fernanda (RPR 84); dam once-raced (34) half-sister to Listed winners Tha'Ir (7f-1m2f) and Flashing Colour (7f); seemingly the Weld second-choice on debut.

runners.comment: Staying on fifth here last month a step forward; longer trip to suit
runners.spotlight: Better of two runs at this venue in fillies maidens this term on latest when staying on fifth over 1m; return to this longer trip to suit and may not have to improve too much to play a role.

runners.comment: Debutante possibly best watched
runners.spotlight: River Boyne filly is second foal of a 1m winner (RPR 70), a sister to useful 6f-1m winner Sir Roderic, and half-sister to useful winners Comfort Line (7f/1m) and Dew Line (1m1f-1m4f); debutante possibly best watched.

runners.comment: Last month's C&D fourth a step in the right direction although more needed
runners.spotlight: Last month's C&D fourth a step in the right direction although more needed to play a leading role here.

runners.comment: 165,000gns yearling by Kodiac; market probably best guide on debut
runners.spotlight: Kodiac filly cost 165,000gns as a yearling; first foal; dam 1m2f 2yo/11.4f winner (RPR 78), half-sister to smart 1m-1m4f winner Windshear; market probably best guide on debut.

racecards.betting_forecast: 5/2 Candleford Green, 11/4 Angelight, 7/2 Etawa, 11/2 Guy's Girl, 12/1 Offshore Bay,  Walk The Highline, 14/1 Parga Diamond, 20/1 Green Rose, 25/1 Imnoaprilfool, 50/1 Ocean Diamond

racecards.race_name: Ladies Day July 26th Apprentice Handicap

runners.comment: AW maiden winner whose opening mark looks workable and could play a big role
runners.spotlight: Wootton Bassett colt outran big odds for M Halford/T Collins team in late-season Leopardstown maiden (soft); off the mark on yard debut in 1m2f AW maiden in March, staying on strongly; opening mark looks workable and could play a big role.

quotes.race: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Maiden
quotes.quote: He had a lovely run last year for Mr Halford and Woodshaw Whisper came to us a couple of months ago. He's done nothing wrong since he joined us, very uncomplicated and handles a good surface. He could go a bit further - Colin Keane, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

runners.comment: Front-running Navan premier handicap winner on a career-high mark but respected
runners.spotlight: Has been kept busy but relishing his workload, scoring for the fifth time when making all in 1m2f Navan premier handicap last month, rallying well; up to a career-high now but admirable sort and no surprise if he went close again.

quotes.quote: I thought Wesley [Joyce, jockey] was actually going a bit too fast! Everybody has been saying Sunriseontheboyne wasn't staying, but we knew he stayed. I think we were done for a little bit of toe the last day, so decided we weren't going to let that happen today. He has been coming out well out of stalls, so the plan was to make the running, kick on two-and-a-half or three furlongs down and see if we could get home. It was nice to get it and is a lovely pot at our local track - Michael Mulvany, trainer.

runners.comment: Best juvenile form gives him definite claims but others preferred on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Decent juvenile maiden form but way below best on seasonal return in AW maiden won by Woodshaw Whisper in March when keen in first-time cheekpieces; gelded since and others preferred on handicap debut.

runners.comment: Killarney third a career-best; could find more over this longer trip on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in AW 2yo maiden in December and last month's Killarney third (fourth has won since) his best run so far; could find more over this longer trip on handicap debut.

runners.comment: Recent maiden run here encouraging; longer trip could bring more on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Recent comeback run here was a step in the right direction, staying on late over 1m but well held at Cork on Friday.

runners.breeder: Irish National Stud Mare Syndicate Iv
runners.comment: Yet to convince in handicaps, others preferred
runners.spotlight: Opening handicap efforts just fair, blinkers worn here last time now replaced by cheekpieces; down 4lb from opening mark but others preferred.

runners.comment: Of limited appeal entering handicaps but drop back in trip should suit
runners.spotlight: Encouraging debut run behind Woodshaw Whisper at Dundalk in March but well held twice since in turf maidens (cheekpieces tried latest now discarded) over further; of limited appeal entering handicaps but drop back in trip should suit but predicted rain may not.

runners.comment: Hasn't threatened in maidens over shorter; potential improver upped in trip
runners.spotlight: Hasn't threatened in three maidens over shorter trips; potential improver upped in trip here for handicap debut.

runners.comment: Keen and didn't stay 1m4f at Roscommon; cheekpieces tried and back in trip, could go well
runners.spotlight: Well-backed when scoring decisively over 1m1f at Tipperary in April (yielding), too keen and didn't stay 1m4f at Roscommon since; cheekpieces now tried and back in trip; could go well.

racecards.betting_forecast: 100/30 Woodshaw Whisper, 4/1 Onemoredance, 11/2 Sunriseontheboyne, 6/1 Report To Station, 13/2 Nepal, 8/1 Truth Be Told, 9/1 Starford, 12/1 No Mo Cash, 16/1 School Of Athens

racecards.race_name: Societies Welcome At Gowran Park Golf Club Handicap

runners.comment: AW winner in March, failed to reproduce that form when favourite at Carlisle 16 days ago
runners.spotlight: AW winner at Southwell in March; failed to reproduce that form when favourite at Carlisle 16 days ago; overall turf form is not persuasive.

runners.comment: Overall form tends to suggest she is more effective on AW but fair chance all the same
runners.spotlight: Three wins at this trip; overall form tends to suggest she is more effective on AW; fair chance all the same in this grade.

runners.comment: Third placings over C&D and Fairyhouse provide grounds for optimism, blinkers may help
runners.spotlight: Winner for Michael Dods over 1m1f last season; recent third placings over C&D and 1m2f at Fairyhouse provide grounds for optimism; blinkers may help; father/daughter combination has struck twice in handicaps in recent weeks, drawn high, but big chance nonetheless.

stable_tour.quote: He's basically what you see. He won at Hamilton off 53 in early August over 1m1f and then went back over 1m2f at Ayr. He ran okay but I'm tempted to pull him back a furlong or two now and see how he copes. He's rated 60 and is capable off his current mark. 28-08-24

runners.comment: Best form on AW, lacks the advantage of a recent run, not an obvious contender
runners.spotlight: Best form on AW, rated 11lb higher in that sphere; lacks the advantage of a recent run; not an obvious contender.

quotes.quote: Run The Jewels disappointed in Cork the last day. We always thought he'd be better over 1m and they just go the extra stride quicker over the straight 7f at Cork which caught him out. He likes racing with plenty of daylight and loves travelling, so back with a bend today from the wide draw helped him. Over the moon with that - Daniel McLoughling, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Follow Us On Twitter @DundalkStadium Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Run The Jewels is a big raw horse and I'd say that surface is plenty quick enough for him. He'll come on plenty from that and with a bit more racing he might drop his head - Nathan Crosse, rider

runners.comment: Mostly out of form for his most recent trainer, hard to have much confidence in his chance
runners.spotlight: Two wins were at two for George Boughey; mostly out of form for his most recent trainer; hard to have much confidence in his chance.

runners.comment: Seven-time AW winner, 1-14 on turf, unlikely to improve that record on recent evidence
runners.spotlight: Seven-time AW winner, 1-14 on turf; unlikely to improve that record on recent evidence; finished with only behind her over C&D early last month.

runners.comment: Best form last season was on heavy ground, needs to step up from an outing at Killarney
runners.spotlight: Failed to stay 1m4f at Galway on final start last season; career-best when second over 1m  at Killarney last October, but that was on heavy ground; needs to step up from an outing at the same venue last month; hooded now.

runners.comment: Ordinary form over longer distances this season, not sure to be suited by this trip
runners.spotlight: AW winner; 0-4 on turf; not at best since joining this yard from Marco Botti; ordinary form over longer distances this season; hard to be sure if this trip will suit; sole win gained at 1m4f.

runners.comment: Won twice in 2023, failed to score last year, held by Roderick on running at Naas in April
runners.spotlight: Won for Mark McNiff at Sligo and Bellewstown in 2023; now 8lb below last winning mark; has struggled in first two starts for Noel Kelly and is held by Roderick on running at Naas in April.

runners.comment: 1-23, best on AW, good turf effort on penultimate start, failed to reproduce last time
runners.spotlight: 1-23, best on AW; good turf effort when runner-up over C&D on penultimate start; failed to reproduce that form here on latest.

runners.comment: Weak form in three outings last season, has had time to mature but chance is not obvious
runners.spotlight: Weak form in three outings last season; has had time to mature but chance is not obvious.

runners.comment: Still a maiden after 22 outings, no strong reason to believe he can rectify matters here
runners.spotlight: Went close here last October on heavy ground; still a maiden after 22 outings; no strong reason to believe he can rectify matters here; held by Carvalhal on running here 13 days ago.

runners.comment: Making a quick reappearance after Leopardstown second on Thursday, holds an obvious chance
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner now looks on the verge of ending a losing sequence; had plenty of horses behind when runner-up to good current yardstick Harry The Rogue at Naas in April; making a quick reappearance after Leopardstown second on Thursday.

quotes.race: Complete Coverage Of Irish Racing Only On Racing TV Claiming Race
quotes.quote: Roderick hurt himself last time at Dundalk but he has been straightforward otherwise. He's a fine big horse, he's not a Dundalk horse, and he could be more one for hurdles - James McAuley, trainer
Roderick did get a little outpaced but he finished off his race well and that is the main thing. It is clear that he needs six furlongs now - Tony Hamilton, rider.

quotes.race: Edinburgh Gin EBF Stallions Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: He was a bit slow out of the gates but he was relaxed through the race and had no problem coming through the field. He will be better of over a bit further in time - jockey Connor Murtagh

runners.comment: 0-15 on Flat, has shown winning potential on occasion, others have stronger credentials
runners.spotlight: 0-15 on Flat; has shown winning potential on occasion, placed four times; however, others have stronger credentials

runners.comment: Disappointing favourite at Killarney after a good run at this venue, may bounce back now
runners.spotlight: 4-38 on turf but without a win since September 2023;  well-handicapped on old form and has run well here before, including when a 4 1/2l third in April on seasonal/stable debut; disappointing favourite at Killarney when Eagles Whistle finished in front of her; may bounce back now.

quotes.quote: Dazzling Spirit won here last year and I hoped coming back here would work. She ran away with him down the hill but Jamie gets on well with her, that's his fourth win on her - Tom Mullins, trainer.

During the summer jockeys were saying Dazzling Spirit needed a little bit further but she just wouldn't let herself down on the ground. On the soft she's letting herself down and she's getting quicker, that's why I took a chance coming back to seven. At home she's very speedy and her half-sister Powersville was a five or six-furlong mare. She'll go to Galway now for a seven-furlong handicap and that might see her out for the season - Tom Mullins, trainer.

Dazzling Spirit got a lovely run up the rail. She travelled well and hit the line well, she was still a bit green and ran around a bit. She was a bit unlucky last time but she enjoyed herself today - Jamie Powell, rider.

runners.comment: Seems to be improving gradually, fifth on last two starts, more progress needed
runners.spotlight: Seems to be improving gradually; fifth on last two starts, more progress needed, and she is not guaranteed to uphold Killarney form with Dazzling Spirit who failed to run up to market expectations.

runners.comment: First reserve, completely tailed off over 1m4f in first handicap, transformation needed
runners.spotlight: Completely tailed off over 1m4f at Leopardstown in first handicap; transformation needed; first reserve.

runners.comment: Second reserve, started his career in bumpers, weak form in maidens, hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Started his career in bumpers; weak form in maidens, hard to fancy from an opening mark that puts him near the top of this handicap; second reserve.

runners.comment: Third reserve, best form in Britain was over 7f, has found 6f inadequate on last two runs
runners.spotlight: Best form in Britain was over 7f; has found 6f inadequate on last two runs; not a bad run over 1m at this venue three starts ago; third reserve.

racecards.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies Handicap

runners.comment: Found 6f too sharp on return, needs to improve from last month's 7f Curragh run
runners.spotlight: Won 7f Fairyhouse maiden on good ground last summer; some fine runs in defeat, including a neck second in a C&D handicap in September; found 6f too sharp on return; needs to improve from last month's 7f Curragh run; hooded.

quotes.quote: Four Blondes deserved that on last year's form. She's by Gleneagles and wouldn't mind a little bit more ease in the ground. She's out of a six-time winning Exceed And Excel mare but seven furlongs to a mile would be fine. She can be a little bit saucy and has a little bit of a funny head carriage but she could be progressive - Ross O'Sullivan, trainer

stable_tour.quote: There's a fillies' handicap over 7f at Fairyhouse coming up which should really suit her, as she won her maiden around there. She was just collared close home at Gowran the other night. She just had to use up a bit too much petrol early there and it cost her. 11-09-24

runners.comment: C&D maiden winner, fine second here on seasonal debut, put a blot on her record on latest
runners.spotlight: Won C&D maiden (good) with plenty to spare on debut last September; never landed a blow in Naas Listed a month later; sent off 28-1 for handicap debut over C&D on return, on heavy ground outran her odds to finish second; needs to bounce back from a poor Curragh run.

quotes.quote: Marakesh was good and straightforward. She got me into a lovely position and when the gap opened she quickened out nicely. She was green but she put it to bed nicely and you would hope there is improvement there - Billy Lee, rider.

runners.breeder: Al Shira'Aa Farms S A R L
runners.comment: Green on debut, emphatic winner of a five-runner 6f maiden at Fairyhouse, merits respect
runners.spotlight: Slowly away when well beaten fifth on debut on soft ground at Limerick in April; different proposition when an emphatic winner of a five-runner 6f maiden at Fairyhouse late last month; trip should be fine, though she is out of a half-sister to top sprinter Kingsgate Native.

prev_owners.owner: Team Valor International LLC & Gary Barber

runners.comment: Pleasing second of six behind good yardstick Hightimeyouwon at Cork on stable debut
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo; won on debut at Naas (6f, soft-heavy) in March 2023 for Sheila Lavery; ran only twice last season; bought for just 9,000gns in March; fine effort when second of six behind good yardstick Hightimeyouwon at Cork on stable debut.

runners.comment: Second here on seasonal debut, faded tamely when favourite at Roscommon, capable of better
runners.spotlight: Front-running winner of an ordinary 7f Dundalk maiden last November; again tried to make all over 1m at this venue on her seasonal/handicap debut, but was readily picked off by a wide-margin winner; faded tamely when a warm favourite at Roscommon; capable of better.

runners.comment: Denied room before keeping on late at Leopardstown, no apparent excuse  at Naas
runners.spotlight: Narrow winner of a 7f handicap on good ground at the Curragh on third outing of the season; unlucky not to finish closer over 1m2f at Leopardstown on next start, denied room before keeping on late; no apparent excuse over 1m at Naas four weeks ago.

quotes.race: View Restaurant At Dundalk Stadium Median Auction Maiden (Div II)
quotes.quote: We didn't go very fast early. Neo Smart picked up nice into the straight. The second horse headed her but to be fair she was only getting going to the line. She handled the surface well - Rory Cleary, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.owner: Dan Kiely/Leonard Kinsella/Mrs E P Harty/Jennifer Coyle
runners.comment: Began season brightly with Curragh third, well below her best on two most recent outings.
runners.spotlight: 1-18 on turf, the win coming early last season at Naas (6f, yielding); started this campaign brightly with Curragh third; well below her best on two most recent outings.

quotes.race: Book Your Summer Season BBQ Packages At Naas Racecourse Handicap
quotes.quote: Tai Tam Bay is small but very very tough. A couple of times last year she looked like winning but was just too hard on herself early on and got caught at the finish. We spent a lot of time over the winter trying to get that out of her. We said today we'd let her bowl along over the short six and not be fighting her. I think seven, even a mile, is what she wants in my book - Edward Harty, trainer, speaking to Racing TV

runners.comment: Dundalk winner, no threat at Cork on return, potentially interesting in her first handicap
runners.spotlight: Promise on yielding-to-soft on debut at the Curragh (1m) in November; won in fine style dropped back to 7f at Dundalk in December; posed no threat in a 1m conditions event at Cork on seasonal debut; potentially interesting in her first handicap.

runners.comment: Picked up initial handicap/turf experience at the Curragh, likely to be sharper now
runners.spotlight: Won over 1m at Dundalk on the first of two starts at two for her former yard; picked up initial handicap/turf experience when fourth of eighth at the Curragh three weeks ago; likely to be sharper now.

runners.comment: Slotted into handicap company effectively when going close over this trip at Fairyhouse
runners.spotlight: Best effort for Ralph Beckett came over 7f on AW at Wolverhampton; ordinary form in three maiden runs for this stable over three different trip; slotted into handicap company effectively when beaten only a short head over this trip at Fairyhouse; winner Lively is due to put form to the test in the 2.30 race.

runners.comment: Should be sharper as a result of last month's run at Killarney, makes handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Ran twice at two; should be sharper as a result of last month's run at Killarney; makes handicap debut.

runners.spotlight: Has run well in sprint handicaps at Navan and Down Royal; due to run in a 5f maiden at Cork on Friday.

runners.comment: Shock winner over 5f at Down Royal, not guaranteed to reproduce that form over this trip
runners.spotlight: Modest form before recording a shock success over 5f at Down Royal; only 5lb higher but not guaranteed to reproduce that form over this trip.

runners.comment: Ran from out of the handicap on seasonal debut, chance in this grade on her juvenile form
runners.spotlight: Showed ability in maidens as a juvenile; ran from out of the handicap at Fairyhouse on seasonal debut, chance in this grade on her last year's form.

runners.spotlight: Last of five in a 6f maiden on seasonal debut, the better of two juvenile runs was over 7f; from a top stable that has come into form.

stable_tour.quote: She's done well over the winter and can do better at three. I'm hoping she's good enough to win her maiden and go on from there. 23-04-25

runners.comment: Possibly capable of building on a satisfactory fourth at the Curragh on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Midfield in three maidens at 7f-1m on AW and soft ground; Possibly capable of building on a satisfactory fourth over a slightly shorter trip at the Curragh on handicap debut.

runners.comment: 7f Roscommon third seemed promising, dropped away in 1m event at Leopardstown ten days ago
runners.spotlight: 15-race maiden, runner-up in 5f nurseries at Down Royal and Dundalk last season; 7f Roscommon third seemed promising, dropped away in 1m event at Leopardstown ten days ago; return to 7f should help.

runners.comment: Indifferent form in maidens, hard to make a strong case for her on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Indifferent form in four maidens during April/May; hard to make a strong case for her on handicap debut.

runners.comment: Has posted respectable displays at around 6f, this trip may bring out the best in him
runners.spotlight: 0-8 but has run well in defeat more than once, notably when third of nine in a valuable nursery at Cork on final start of 2024; out of the money on both starts this term; this trip may bring out the best in him.

runners.comment: Showed some ability over 1m at Leopardstown in first handicap, 7f may not be ideal
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability when ninth of 18 over 1m at Leopardstown in first handicap; plenty of improvement required and 7f may not be ideal.

runners.comment: Big price when down the field at Leopardstown, due to run in the 8.15 at Cork on Friday
runners.spotlight: Big price when down the field at Leopardstown ten days ago; due to run in the 8.15 at Cork on Friday

runners.comment: Produced massive improvement when going close at Down Royal, has to be taken seriously now
runners.spotlight: Finished last on his final two starts last. season; same fate on first outing this term; produced massive improvement when going close at Down Royal; has to be taken seriously now

runners.comment: Appeared not to stay 1m2f at the Curragh on third qualifying start, may do better now
runners.spotlight: Appeared not to stay 1m2f at the Curragh on third qualifying start;  relatively unexposed, may do better now.

runners.comment: 0-7 on turf, two best runs have come on testing ground over C&D, more rain would help
runners.spotlight: 0-7 on turf, two best runs have come on testing ground over C&D; beaten 6 1/4l when fourth of 10 here on latest; more rain would help.

racecards.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden

runners.comment: Wootton Bassett colt cost 500,000gns, dam a Listed winner, capable 5lb claimer aboard
runners.spotlight: 500,000gns yearling; third foal; Wootton Bassett half-brother to minor juvenile winner Blindsided; dam Listed winner, out of a winning half-sister to Group 1 winner Sendawar; apprentice has ridden two winners for the stable this year, including the juvenile Warsaw.

runners.comment: Has run in strong maidens, needs to find more, jockey has also ridden Maximum Scepticism
runners.spotlight: Slow to break, ran green and not clear run when midfield in a good-class 6f Navan maiden in April; again kept good company when fourth of six over 7f at Leopardstown; needs to raise his game; jockey has also ridden Maximum Scepticism.

runners.comment: Cost E80,000, first foal by St Mark's Basilica out of a Group-placed 6f winner by Zoffany
runners.spotlight: E80,000 yearling; first foal; by St Mark's Basilica out of a Group-placed 6f winner by Zoffany; dam has a solid sprinting pedigree.

runners.comment: Fair form in two races dominated by Aidan O'Brien, interesting with a valuable 5lb claimed
runners.spotlight: E225,000 yearling; satisfactory debut when fourth in a 6f maiden at the Curragh, faring a little better than a shorter-priced stablemate in a race in which Aidan O'Brien saddled winner and second; not beaten far in fifth in a 7f Curragh maiden win which Ballydoyle again provided the first two; interesting with a valuable 5lb claimed.

runners.comment: Cost E160,000, one of three for the stable, the other two have experience
runners.spotlight: E160,000 yearling; third foal; Space Blues colt out of a 1m4f AW winner who is a sister to Irish 1,000 Guineas winner Just The Judge; one of three for the stable, the other two have experience.

runners.comment: 25-1 always at the back on debut at Listowel; cheekpieces on now, safe to ignore
runners.spotlight: 25-1 always at the back on debut at Listowel; cheekpieces on now; safe to ignore.

runners.comment: Eighth foal, half-brother by Zoustar to two winners, dam a well-related French winner
runners.spotlight: E30,000 Y; eighth foal; half-brother by Zoustar to two winners; dam French winner, half-sister to the useful Ershaad, out of Canadian 1m2f Grade 1 winner Insight.

runners.comment: Has struggled in two outings, well held by Maximum Scepticism on Curragh running.
runners.spotlight: Has struggled in two outings; well held by Maximum Scepticism on Curragh running.

runners.comment: Cost E200,000, dam an unraced half-sister to two Pattern winners, could be in the mix
runners.spotlight: E200,000 yearling; second foal; Wootton Bassett colt is out of an unraced half-sister to winners Forces Of Darkness (French Group 3) and Waterloo Bridge (5f 2yo Group 2), out of 6f 2yo Listed winner; could be in the mix.

runners.comment: Never a factor on debut in a Navan maiden in which Estoublon finished sixth
runners.spotlight: Never a factor on debut in a Navan maiden in which Estoublon finished sixth.

runners.comment: Half-brother to six winners, including 5f Listed scorer Shumookhi, dam unraced
runners.spotlight: 3,000gns yearling; tenth foal; half-brother to six winners including Listed scorer Shumookhi; dam unraced half-sister to Group 3 winner Windsor Knot
